    Introduce an Asymmetric switch in Vision Settings. Only asymmetric parts can have vision offsets. The Vision Offsets fields are disabled in the UI, if asymmetric is off. This should prevent accidental entering or pressing the Detect button (confusing it with Test Alignment).

    turn disrupts confirmation flow control.

    reverse question mark U+00BF, due to common Linux fonts not supporting
    the special Unicode U+2753 character (observed on Kubuntu 22.04).

Merge: f557aa6aa9 9ed02d4ee9

    Feature / Minimum Speed and Resolution aware Interpolation, G-code

commit 9ed02d4ee9cbce7c6c0f352de7d6602312b2b0ac
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Fri Jan 13 09:38:22 2023 +0100

    Improve feed-rate, acceleration, jerk minimum rates and decimal G-code formatting and compression.
    - Fix missing driver units conversion for feed, acceleration, jerk rates in GcodeDriver.
    - Use driver units to propose G20/G21 in CONNECT_COMMAND.
    - Fully declare minimum feed, acceleration, jerk rates on Driver.
    - Use minimum acceleration to limit interpolation (in addition to existing criteria).
    - Use minimum rates and driver units to derive number of needed decimal digits for rate specification in G-code MOVE_TO_COMMAND.
    - Use axis resolution and driver units to derive number of needed decimal digits for coordinates in G-code MOVE_TO_COMMAND.
    - Use configurable quote and bracket characters to exclude parts of G-code lines from compression and comments removal.
    - Detect RepRapFirmware M115 response correctly.

    * internationalization improvements: org.openpnp.machine.reference.driver, org.openpnp.machine.reference.driver.wizards, org.openpnp.machine.reference.feeder.wizards, org.openpnp.machine.reference.psh, org.openpnp.machine.reference.signaler.wizards, org.openpnp.machine.reference.solutions, org.openpnp.machine.reference.vision.wizards: Translations.getString code marked with //$NON-NLS-1$ comment to support eclipse internationalization
    
    * internationalization improvements: org.openpnp.machine.reference.wizards, org.openpnp.model, org.openpnp.scripting, org.openpnp.spi.base: Translations.getString code marked with //$NON-NLS-1$ comment to support eclipse internationalization
    
    * internationalization improvements: Translations.getString code marked with //$NON-NLS-1$ //$NON-NLS-2$ //$NON-NLS-3$ comment (for multiple strings in one line) to support eclipse internationalization
    
    * zh_CN the Locale argument bugfix

commit 620ccf2623b8f9076c14616758535443ef678b92
Author: Alexander Willer <kontakt@alexander-willer.de>
Date:   Mon Sep 5 10:34:19 2022 +0200

    Revert "Undo ee4de22 to always test all script engines"
    
    This reverts commit d5c6b8ee18460a58b53df38baf7b904f27cf9841.
    
    Reason is that Nashorn 15.0 doesn't work with Java 15 and Nashorn 15.1
    and up don't work with Java 8. As JS scripting support is already broken
    for Java 15, this allows the tests to pass till Java 8/9/10 support is
    dropped and Nashorn can be bumped to 15.4.

17	4	src/test/java/org/openpnp/scripting/ScriptingTest.java

    Add advanced threaded scripting test
    
    Executes beanshell 20 times in parallel, each beanshell instance
    triggers another script hook causing nested threaded beanshell, nashorn
    and jython script execution.

commit ee6b96ec0fb7077b56901666a641897d51bee22a
Author: Alexander Willer <kontakt@alexander-willer.de>
Date:   Fri Sep 2 11:16:44 2022 +0200

    Allow infinte engines, auto-evict excess engines
    
    Infinite engines can be created to avoid blocking, but all but five
    engines of each type are evicted from the pool after a few seconds to
    keep memory usage within reasonable bounds.
    
    The idle engine limit should never be hit under reasonable use.

6	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/scripting/Scripting.java

    Therefor, it has to be included separtely.

commit c9dca1394707a78e247bb1658686bc037d4c0eb4
Author: Alexander Willer <kontakt@alexander-willer.de>
Date:   Tue Aug 30 17:36:46 2022 +0200

    Abandon simple cache in favor of a KeyedObjectPool
    
    This commit introduces a pooled approach to script engine caching to avoid issues that could occur if only a single scripting engine was used for concurrent / nested invocations.
    With the pooled approach, engines that are borrowed cannot be re-used until they are given back to the pool, leading to creation of another engine in the pool if two scripts need to run at the same time with the same engine type.

commit ca6b73fd1f82388c56ae453eb8b4cb103587d324
Merge: 63901a57fb 69ac19d766
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Jul 3 12:30:18 2022 +0200

    Merge pull request #1434 from markmaker/fix/better-feeder-nozzle-messages
    
    Fix / Improve Pick Part Action Error Messages

commit 69ac19d7669fe3e117ab2d59ab6f06cf7698aba6
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Jul 3 12:08:40 2022 +0200

    Improve the error messages when trying to pick a part from the GUI.
    
    This is about nozzle tips compatible with the selected nozzle and with
    the package to be picked. If the nozzle tip on the currentkly selected
    nozzle is not compatible, the function tries to load a compatible nozzle
    tip, if automatic loading is enabled. Conversely, if automatic nozzle
    tip loading is disabled, the user is told to consider switching it on.
    
    This fix handles some complications:
    
    - The automatic nozzle tip loading option was suggested, even though it
    was already on, but another condition prevented it.
    - A compatible nozzle tip could be already loaded on another nozzle, so
    the user is instead told to select the other nozzle instead.
    - A part could already be loaded on the selected nozzle, preventing
    nozzle tip unloading/loading in the first place.
    
    The method `org.openpnp.spi.NozzleTip.getNozzleWhereLoaded()` is
    promoted to the `Nozzle` interface to be made available outside
    `ReferenceNozzleTip`. The method was renamed to match
    `Nozzle.loadNozzleTip()`.

commit 139df641b661b658a35aaf9b24ae81e069779d90
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Fri Jun 10 14:19:04 2022 +0200

    Change ReferenceStripFeeder Rotation in Tape to EIA-481 standard.
    
    - Rotation in Tape is now unified to be relative to a tape with the
    sprocket holes on top, as per EIA-481-C.
    - Existing feeders are automatically migrated.
    - Added unified tooltips to feeder wizards, ReferenceStripFeeder,
    BlindsFeeder, ReferencePushPullFeeder.
    - Utils2D.getAngleFromPoint() fixed to use +X = 0° based angles.
    - Added CHANGES entry to mark the version.
    - Small fix to XmlSerialize.convertMarkupToHtml() to keep whitespace at
    end of pre-broken line.

commit f4e64cf38e08bcb51756681a5e19ce3019da1dfb
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 13:29:41 2022 +0200

    Allow for pick angle tolerance under limited articulation.
    
    Some feeders use vision to determine the precise pick location and
    angle. Under limited articulation Rotation Mode we need to predict not
    only the pick-to-place articulation but also the needed leeway on both
    the pick and the alignment/placement side. This adds it on the pick side
    (it was previously only present omn the alignment side).

3	2	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/AbstractMotionPlanner.java
25	6	src/main/java/org/openpnp/spi/base/AbstractNozzle.java

    limiting on nozzle rotation axes (it would be wrong for peeler rotation
    axes).

    ReferencePushPullFeeder, reference by name only for XML persistence.

commit c1b929c5c6d94476bb04e3794d13da722d20ef9d
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Mar 6 16:32:15 2022 +0100

    Feature/DetectRectlinearSymmetry Pipeline Stage (#1386)
    
    * * First draft revision of DetectRectlinearSymmetry.
    * Fixes and refactores some aspects of part size check, in order to parametrize the expected part size.
    
    * * Added angular contrast and rect-linear cross-section diagnostic maps.
    * Refinement and bug-fixing.
    
    * * Introduce Gaussian kernels overall.
    * Add a property to control the angular contrast smoothing.
    * Make the margin absolute.
    * "North" indicator on diagnostics.
    
    * * Fixing the symmetry function. Take only the error square.
    * Fix ugly font in Pipeline Editor stage description.
    
    * * Add Hull symmetry function.
    * Check symmetry over the whole cross-section, with padding where necessary.
    * Extract KernelUtils.
    
    * * Simplify getPossiblePipelinePropertyOverride() and allow for any type T without conversion.
    
    * * Made stage robust against way too large minWidth/minHeight.
    * Added masked input image support, and OutlineSymmetryMasked to clamp truly asymmetric parts.
    * Added minFeatureSize to ignore small/infrequent specks on masked input images.
    * Fixed symmetry score.
    * Final naming and comments/property descriptions.
    
    * * Add more elaborate comments.
    
    * * Allow 0° search angle for demo purposes.
    
    * * Optimize diagnostic overlay sizes.
    
    * * Add maximum allowed search distance to ReferenceBottomVision and Wizard.
    * Set pre-rotate/not pre-rotate angle correctly.
    
    * Set pipeline properties.
    
    * Add ParameterBool stage
    
    * Introduce symmetry as a switch. Add threshold, built-in.
    
    * In the Pipeline Editor, sort properties by declaration sequence rather than by alphabet.
    
    * Replace Nozzle tip calibration pipeline with DetectCircularSymmetry one.
    
    * Consolidate DetectRectlinearSymmetry properties and descriptions. Add stock pipeline and visions settings.
    
    * Add soft edge and soft factor to MaskHsv to favor "probabilistic" behavior. Optimized default Gamma.
    
    * Change default gamma
    
    * Soft MaskHsv improved.
    
    * Let the ImageRead stage handle images as if captued, i.e. emulate the camer UPP and resolution.
    
    * Pipeline preparation bugfixes, pipeline optimization.
    
    * Keep iterated minimum size.
    
    * Refactor ImageRead stage into using a ImageUtils method.
    
    * Cosmetic changes optimized when documenting.
    
    * Move the Max. Pick Tolerance (former Max. Search Distance) to the nozzle tip. Use it as tolerance in vision circle mask etc. Add and use the Min. Part Diameter.
    
    * Needed to allow larger than default pick tolerances for the (hopefully exagerated) test.

1	1	src/main/java/org/openpnp/gui/IssuesAndSolutionsPanel.java

commit 2ddc56ccf3e21213e821fecc2346ec0cb3bc605b
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sat Nov 27 17:40:55 2021 +0100

    Fix: Advanced Camera Calibration startup race.
    
    Somehow, Advanced Camera Calibration configuration needs to be properly
    loaded and committed before the first frame is captured. On startup,
    Issues & Solutions is finding issues, and displaying the first one. Some
    issues query the camera for dimension, promting a camera capture to get
    the frame size. By delaying the Issues & Solutions startup, we can
    circumvent that.

commit f4f571a7b4bc22461069db61e593f510123ea61b
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sat Nov 20 17:33:37 2021 +0100

    Added LocationOption.SuppressCameraCalibration
    
    Added LocationOption.SuppressCameraCalibration to suppress the new
    advanced camera calibration head offsets, used to compensate for camera
    tilt. This is used in the simulated cameras to get correct "physical"
    camera locations.

2	2	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/solutions/HeadSolutions.java

commit dcc8f36c32df9c3e21a0696068b82c0ad38459da
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sat Oct 9 13:24:26 2021 +0200

    * Completely revised the way axis limits and wrap-around are applied in the AbstractMotionPlanner. It now supports transformed axes, i.e. the angular math is properly done in the HeadMountable coordinate space rather than in the raw axis coordinate space.
    * Introduce the RotationMode for machines with shared C and/or limited angular articulation. An optimization mode is also available.
    * Using Nozzle.prepareForPickAndPlaceArticulation(), the upcoming articulation must be prepared before a pick-and-place-cycle, so the proper angular base offset can be applied to the nozzle.
    * The Job Processor properly prepares the angular articulation.
    * Nozzle head offset calibration properly prepares the angular articulation.
    * Make sure the Discard cycle does not rotate a limited articulation nozzle.
    * The Feeders Panel pick action properly prepares the angular articulation, using the Test Alignment Angle as the assumed placement rotation.
    * Persist the Test Alignment Angle in ReferenceBottomVision, make it publicly accessible.
    * The rotation P button on the jog controls will now move to the 90° step angle nearest to the mid-position of a limited articulation nozzle.
    * NozzleTip calibration will respect rotation axis limits and make sure no offset is currently applied.
    
    * Moved duplicate getMachine() code to base class AbstractHeadMountable.

commit b0797c6402f107bb76f671e3150f562ba7d3cf1f
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Sep 19 13:02:58 2021 +0200

    * The ContactProbeNozzle now references its probing actuator by object, rather than by name. The name is only used for XML persistence.
    * Added ContactProbeNozzle Issues & Solutions error for missing contact sensing actuator.
    * Using ContactProbeNozzle cached Z offsets is immediately switched off, when the method is switched to Off. Previously, this has only become effective after a machine homing.
    * Support axis transforms in Issues & Solutions checks against the Z axis.
    * Generate probing G-code with proper axis letter, probing limit according to soft-limit(s) and feed-rate according to (new) speed factor.
    * Add cautionary note to the Issues & Solutions issues that offer to revert an advanced configuration. Make them "Information" rather than "Suggestion".
    * When converting ReferenceNozzle to ContactProbeNozzle and vice versa, the loaded nozzle tip is reassigned. This was previously missing.
    * Extracted new Nozzle.setNozzleTip() method from existing duplicate code.

commit 043c89b73c25716a37a080e388474de4b4842a47
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sat Aug 28 14:28:09 2021 +0200

    * After a direction change, the DirectionalSneakUp backlash compensation method must backtrack, if the sneak-up distance is too small.
    * Automatic calibration of backlash compensation will now select DirectionalSneakUp, if backlash is inconsistent over a sneak-up distance that is larger than the backlash itself.
    * Logarithmic distribution of random moves in automatic calibration of backlash compensation.

17	9	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/AbstractMotionPlanner.java
22	15	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/solutions/CalibrationSolutions.java

commit d08fa3d1e4d8ddbeccb801638302315df7d88e08
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sat Aug 28 00:02:14 2021 +0200

    * Auto Safe Z of the camera virtual axes must be restricted to arrow/drag jogging. Other targeted user action must not trigger it. Otherwise, 3D units per pixel will be prevented.
    * Fixed dependent head offset propagation.
    * Made AbstractMotionPath motion planning more conservative: co-linear segments with different feed-rate, acceleration and jerk limits will be broken up.
    * Fixed bug in move interpolation. If two (or more) probed special segments were too small, the feed-rate-limit was not correctly calculated, resulting in random (slow) speeds.
    * No units in CameraView Z indicator (like all the other length indicators).

commit e915fe5d0d0ae213aeab5ba1fa00066ec49fea7c
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Wed Aug 25 21:19:57 2021 +0200

    * Introduced 3D Units per Pixel into Vision Operations according to camera (virtual) Z axis coordinate.
    * All vision operations must now properly move the camera to the right Z axis coordinate.
    * Camera.getUnitsPerPixelAtZ() was introduced to get UPP on the camera Z axis plane.
    * Camera.isUnitsPerPixelAtZCalibrated() was introduced to determine if a camera has 3D UPP.
    * openCvUtils, VisionUtils, FluentCv now use getUnitsPerPixelAtZ() throughout.
    * Separate scroll-wheel CameraView working plane has been removed, all is now done with the camera (virtual) Z axis. This precludes the bottom camera to use 3D UPP at the moment. However, it seems there is no reasonable application for this anyway, you can always bring the subject into the focal plane using the nozzle. If this was ever second-guessed, the Z axis of the subject movable (e.g. nozzle) would have to be used instead and somehow "selected" as the subject for the camera.
    * AbstractCamera.autoViewPlaneZ was deprecated. 3D UPP will now either be off or always active.
    * The AdvancedLoosePartFeeder, BlindsFeeder, ReferenceDragFeeder, ReferenceLeverFeeder, ReferencePushPullFeeder, ReferenceStripFeeder and respective Wizards have specifically been reworked to support setting the camera Z axis right in setup and routine vision ops.
    * When 3D UPP is active and Z information is missing, the feeders will report an error. Users will have to probe the Z coordinate first, before vision based Auto-Setup etc. is possible. BlindsFeeder and ReferencePushPullFeeder will automatically propose Z from a related array or template feeder.
    * The FiducialLocator has been checked, and its visual homing support amended to assume the default Z working plane coordinate.
    * VisionSolutions and CalibrationSolutions have been reworked to make sure specific primary/secondary UPP are used and camera Z axis always set.
    * Nozzle tip changer vision was complemented with an Adjust Z setting to shift the focal plane away from the corresponding changer (nozzle) location. To make sure the changer slot surface will properly scaled in the camera view.
    * Pipeline Stages have been reworked to use 3D UPP.
    * The Pipeline Editor results Panel has been reworked to use 3D UPP.
    * BlindsFeeder's and ReferencePushPullFeeder's proprietary nullLocation hacks have been replaced with Location.origin and Location.isInitialized().
    * Location.deriveLengths() method was introduced to encapsulate units conversion.

commit 768ffe734370bfd5a9856103144ac17bf4419403
Merge: 8317154710 4e7f88478a
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Mon Aug 23 21:00:28 2021 +0200

commit e7661821a0bf42925170d36557a2d50ca2b8c6c4
Merge: 9bb394a3d4 9996721118
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Thu Aug 19 00:20:21 2021 +0200

    Merge pull request #1253 from markmaker/feature/issues-and-solutions-machine-calibration-round-2
    
    Feature/Automatic Machine Calibration using Issues & Solutions - Round 2

commit 9996721118c082835ceece4b90fa094dc51532ec
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Wed Aug 18 23:48:41 2021 +0200

    Enhancement and bug-fix round based on test version feed-back
    
    * Copy static texts to clipboard in I&S IssuePanel using right mouse click.
    * I&S conservative solutions proposed when going back to more basic Milestones are now only severity Suggestion (and not Fundamental) and they do no longer block dependent solutions.
    * When replacing an ImageCamera or SimulatedUpLookingCamera with a real OpenPnpCaptureCamera, the old/new camera is now properly (un)registered in the CameraView. No OpenPnP restart required. Furthermore, should a USB device have been assigned in the mean-time, the camera device is properly closed when the solution is undone.
    * Fixed typo AbstractCoordinateAxis.convertFromSystem() (missing "s"), also in ReferenceControllerAxis.
    * Added missing toHeadLocation() transformation to the axis coordinate to HeadMountable transformation.
    * Added proper inter-solution dependencies for many calibration solutions. These are always tested both before proposing the solution and before setting it to solved, i.e. before doing the calibration. This way nothing bad happens, should the preconditions have changed in the mean-time, such as when a prerequisite solution is reopened/undone.
    * HeadSolutions will now discover the initial Nozzle configuration of a migrated machine. If the machine has a Milestone other than "Welcome" (which is only assumed for machines, that still have a NullDriver etc.), the solution is marked as already solved, i.e. it will be hidden by default.
    * Test objects can now be larger relative to the camera dimension.
    * When capturing preliminary nozzle head offsets, they are not updated when very close to the offsets already set. This way calibrated offsets will survive revisiting this rather crude solution. Only the Z of the nozzle is then used to set the fiducial Z and 3D Units per Pixel information.
    * Added a Length.isInitialized() method.
    * Removed Units per Pixel calibration reminder solutions (obsolete).

commit 779aa392600f47f86a64ae6572b7e6795daae308
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sat Aug 14 14:26:26 2021 +0200

    Round-up of UI and Utils improvements and some minor bug-fixes:
    * CameraView now uses bi-cubic instead of only bi-linear interpolation in High Quality mode.
    * SimpleGraph now draws "flatlines", i.e. graphs where y min == y max.
    * SimpleGraphView and TemplateImageControl use of themed color improved/encapsulated. Refactored in ReferenceNozzleTip.
    * Some improvements in UI layout.
    * ReferenceNozzleTipCalibrationWizard some new fields were not disabled when the calibration is disabled.
    * Interface cleanup in AutoFocusProvider.
    * Catch empty nozzle in AutoFocusProviderConfigurationWizard.
    * Centralized angle norming in Utils2D.angleNorm(). Refactored ReferenceBottomVision, BlindsFeeder and ReferencePushPullFeeder.
    * New Location.isInitialized() returns true if at least one of the coordinates are non-zero, assuming the location is therefore initialized.
    * Unified and made publicly available a UiUtils.showError(Throwable t) method to encapsulate the showing of Throwable message boxes.

Merge: c7e83e5787 8d20e61340
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sat Aug 7 22:49:38 2021 +0200

    Merge pull request #1241 from markmaker/fix/axis-rotational-wrap-around-and-interlock
    
    Fix / Rotational Axis Wrap-Around, -180° .. 180° Limiting, Multiple Driver Axis Interlock

commit 8d20e613400253c422ae3265b71fde91eaeed13c
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sat Aug 7 22:26:05 2021 +0200

    * bug-fix: when rotational axis wrap-around and -180° .. 180° limiting is combined with a multiple driver axis interlock, the coordinates may change after the interlock, because the interlock performs a waitForCompletion() which in turn performs the rotational axis wrap-around, which can cause driver and planned coordinates to change. Therefore the coordinates must be reevaluated after possible interlock.

commit d831b39eb4a932d0a155aef17e66a6d998ea3866
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Aug 1 17:57:07 2021 +0200

    * The ReferenceNozzle now stores Actuator object references internally, names are only used for persistence.
    * Therefore changing an actuator name no longer breaks the reference.
    * Nozzle actuator setters/getters by name were removed. Code accessing these was refactored.
    * The ReferenceNozzleVacuumWizard was reworked to use references instead of names.
    * The Nozzle adds simple reminders to Issues & Solutions, when vacuum actuators, assigned drivers, and/or their G-code command/regex are missing.
    * org.openpnp.spi.Actuator.isDriverless() was added to declare when an Actuator does not need a driver. HttpActuator and ScriptActuator are ok to be driverless even though they are derived from ReferenceActuator which is Driver based.
    * org.openpnp.spi.Machine.getAllActuators() was added to get all actuators from all heads and the machine (analog to getAllCameras()).
    
    (cherry picked from commit 9faa7e24db0fdcf29c4d9f181410f31b09216732)

3	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceNozzle.java

commit c19ce75e74d3edfee83f849998343802df36e02c
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Thu May 27 09:14:26 2021 +0200

    * Clear queued commands from the planner, when the machine task/executor is aborted. Otherwise these could unexpectedly be executed in the context of the next task.
    * Note: this only happens when continuous planned motion is enabled and motion commands are actually queued up. The exception leading to the abortion of the commands happens after the moveTo() commands in question. So aborting these queued moves is more conservative than with the NullPlanner, where such motion would already have been executed. The whole motion sequence becomes one transaction, the pending moves are rolled back.
    
    (cherry picked from commit bd8b6968af26aeaa1d915ad6daf389d5bbf0634c)

6	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/AbstractMotionPlanner.java
6	1	src/main/java/org/openpnp/spi/MotionPlanner.java
1	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/spi/base/AbstractMachine.java

    * Fix button/action enabling inconsistency bug

commit 32018d28f31d92a5a92798bf1404bc49cd74a6d2
Author: Justin Nesselrotte <admin@jnesselr.org>
Date:   Thu Jun 10 11:42:03 2021 -0600

    Jnesselr/index feeder (#1211)
    
    * Added IndexFeederProtocol
    
    We still need to implement a few commands, but this is a good starting point.
    
    * Finished the first version of the index protocol
    
    * Refactored feeder protocol class to IndexCommandEncoder
    
    * Refactored encoder to IndexCommands with static classes
    
    Basically, each command is its own static class and we can encode both
    commands and responses. The responses are very useful for tests. We can
    also add a decoding method to these later.
    
    * Refactored Packet class to use a builder pattern
    
    * Introduced IndexResponses to clear up API usage
    
    * Added protcol decoding
    
    * Started on some initial work on Index Feeder + tests
    
    * Switching from actuate -> read to handle timeouts in Marlin
    
    Now, we don't have to worry about timeouts in OpenPnP. We still need
    to be able to parse a timeout response, but by using the "read"
    method, we can assume we'll either get a valid response or a timeout.
    
    * Added TIMEOUT error type
    
    * Added some tests around timeouts
    
    * New Feeder is made if feeder returns wrong UUID on initialization
    
    * Added test to confirm use of existing feeder on wrong uuid
    
    * Fixing wrong test name
    
    * Handle timeout on get slot address
    
    * Added IndexFeeder to reference machine as an option
    
    * Added IndexProperties class
    
    * prepareForJob has better retry handling now
    
    * feed now has better retry handling
    
    * Playing around with Property Sheets
    
    * IndexFeeders can now be searched for and populated
    
    * Handle updating null hardware ID feeders before creating new ones
    
    * ReferenceActuator is made if index actuator doesn't exist
    
    * Verifying the feeder actually gets added to the machine
    
    * More correct loading of machine configuration for index properties
    
    * Fixing get feeder address command
    
    * Added enough stuff to get search and a job running
    
    * Added really simple progress bar to search
    
    * Splitting out property sheets
    
    * setName / getName for the feeder now work correctly
    
    * Improved UI around unconfigured IndexFeeders
    
    * Verifying correct number of property sheets based on feeder state
    
    * Switched INDEX_ACTUATOR to IndexFeederData
    
    * Added IndexFeederSlots class
    
    * Added basic structure around feeder slots
    
    * Fixing IndexFeederTest
    
    * isEnabled is false without slot address and location
    
    * Removed null check on machine in getDataActuator
    
    Other bits of the code thought the actuator could be null, but they
    themselves are called with a machine already loaded. Since the test
    was the only thing that actually cared to check, I removed the check.
    
    * Slot location is not required
    
    There's some weird corner cases around this. A feeder can be in slot A,
    not have a location, then move to slot B. Slot B can have its location
    set but slot A doesn't have a way to set its location currently.

commit bd8b6968af26aeaa1d915ad6daf389d5bbf0634c
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Thu May 27 09:14:26 2021 +0200

    * Clear queued commands from the planner, when the machine task/executor is aborted. Otherwise these could unexpectedly be executed in the context of the next task.
    * Note: this only happens when continuous planned motion is enabled and motion commands are actually queued up. The exception leading to the abortion of the commands happens after the moveTo() commands in question. So aborting these queued moves is more conservative than with the NullPlanner, where such motion would already have been executed. The whole motion sequence becomes one transaction, the pending moves are rolled back.

6	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/AbstractMotionPlanner.java
6	1	src/main/java/org/openpnp/spi/MotionPlanner.java
1	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/spi/base/AbstractMachine.java

commit 9d5e666b5b1881d7ae5c1f58ab525a8491679667
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Tue Apr 20 04:24:36 2021 +0200

    This is a round-up of bug-fixes and conceptually missing basic/util features. (#1169)
    
    Bug-fixes:
    * Bug-fix for #1143 (null pointer exception when part is missing in feeder)
    * Parts table does not update on part property changes.
    * Inconsistent FIRMWARE detection in GcodeDriverSolutions
    * Edit Pipeline does not wait for machine in ReferencePushPullFeederConfigurationWizard, resulting in the lighting actuator failing.
    * Test Alignment in ReferenceBottomVisionPartConfigurationWizard did not conserve rotation of selected nozzle.
    * Nozzle tip calibration failed the homing cycle if enabled on homing, creating a chicken egg situation during machine setup. Added an option to switch off. Improved error messages. This required  UiUtils.messageBoxOnExceptionLater() for deferred GUI tasks (in this case deferred throws/error messages).
    * null check missing in AbstractHeadMountable.toHeadLocation(), refactored/extracted AbstractHeadMountable.applyConfiguration() for future use.
    * Pipeline stages that throw exceptions are logged for easier diagnostics. The underlying issue that some exceptions should fail the pipeline immediately is still open.
    * In the Pipeline Editor: custom Object type property sheet handlers need resetting when switching stages.
    
    Missing features/utilities:
    * Machine Setup tree recursive/topological home() is missing from NozzleTip.
    * compareTo() missing in Length
    * getXyzLengthTo() i.e. length including Z missing in Location
    * Added Location.origin constant as the (0, 0, 0, 0) coordinate, for easy use in the form vector.getXyzLengthTo(Location.origin) to measure vector length.
    * multiply() missing in Location
    * permutateNozzle() missing in Location, also fixed parameter name in permutateCamera()
    * Added ImageUtils.clone() to deep copy a BufferedImage.

commit 090a5e2f9ea7b5f837c67f7a4c802dbe4631e20f
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Apr 11 18:25:37 2021 +0200

    Maximum Part Height/Part Diameter configuration on the NozzleTip.
    Used for Dynamic Safe Z and in upcoming PRs.
    The Part.isPartHeightUnknown() method is introduced so a future implementation may add a formal boolean instead of just testing partHeight <= 0.0.
    Nozzle.getSafePartHeight() is added to allow for consistent nozzle positioning when part height is unknown (Safe Z, probing starting height etc.)

commit d3a4c3942c445c89b8ff5c4da3f078bcc234f653

    Feature: HeapFeeder (#1159)
    
    * Added(optional) option-flags to the moveTo command.
    Easy to extend (more elements in the enum), easy to ignore in drivers
    that do not support the given option.
    
    * moved enum to interface Movable, changed all affected classes
    
    * implemented RAW moves for nozzle.
    
    * Switched to more generic names and CamelCase.
    (comment #623142959 from @vonnieda)
    
    * Core data structures and configuration panel
    
    * More structure. implemented cleanup before feeding
    
    * Code cleanup, added javadoc, fixed some null pointer exceptions and
    logic bugs. Default Pipelines still WIP.
    
    * Changed the drophHeight to avoid parts jumping out of the dropBox
    
    * Added MatchPartsTemplate Pipeline stage (goes over all rotated
    rectangles instead of only a single one)
    
    * make rotatedRect fit the part, independent of orientation of orientation
    of the template and the input rectangles
    
    * Fixed nullpointer on empty lists
    
    * Fixed description.
    One logic bug in the HeapFeeder(method always false)

    Added stage for matching multiple rotated rectangles against a template
    image.
    
    * new vision stage: select single rect
    
    selects from a list of rotated rectangles a single one (user defines the
    position)
    
    * missed so include the import
    
    * FileName prefix

    top/bottom vision), you can now use a prefix.

commit 7a682683f28a0f370214b4ebdd3f71daf7e3bbf2
Author: TWilmer <TWilmer@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu Feb 25 05:08:03 2021 +0100

    Add read for http actuator (#1130)
    
    * HTTP Actuator Read URL addition
    
    * Fix dialog order
    
    * Add regexp handling for HTTP Actuator
    
    * Add regex handling for HttpActuator read
    
    The regex is empty per default and the output is just passed through.
    If the regex is matched it's the same as in the gdcode driver that
    the matched output is produced. This is usefull if the returned
    page contains several return values.
    
    * Add a unit test to HttpActuator read
    
    The unit test provides a sample web server (built in from java)
    and provides one url with a value and the value is checked that
    it matched the regex.

commit 0a496ec49b46678d315202ec34ccd7434d076579
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Thu Jan 21 00:02:38 2021 +0100

    * Issues & Solutions: many new solutions added (includes linked new Wiki content)
    * Issues & Solutions: for initial machine setup, automatic replacement of the simulation NullDriver.
    * Issues & Solutions: for initial machine setup, automatic replacement of the simulation ImageCamera and SimulatedUpCamera.
    * Create backups for all the configuration XML files.
    * Support 0 fps in ReferenceStripFeederConfigurationWizard.
    * Cleanup: Changed AbstractReferenceDriver CommunicationsType from String to Enum.
    * Bug-fix: Marlin does not understand G-code with both M and G code on the same line (as it should), a newline was added.
    * Bug-fix: the BufferedImageCamera must remain lightweight and not start a thread or register machine listeners.
    * Bug-fix: feeders without parts (i.e. parts that were deleted).
    * Bug-fix: FeedersPanel tab index race condition.

Date:   Fri Jan 15 20:24:08 2021 +0100

    * Added quotes on stage names in diagnostic messages.

3	3	src/main/java/org/openpnp/vision/pipeline/CvStage.java

commit 4fb4019671121f218378ef3fa714de56cb8dee33
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Fri Jan 15 19:48:57 2021 +0100

    Issue: pipelines and stages would often generate java.lang.NullPointerException when named stages were not found
    or java.lang.ClassCastException when result models had the wrong type, including when Exceptions are propagated
    through results. Only few pipeline callers used all the tricks to diagnose all failures correctly.
    
    The non-descript Java Exceptions are quite unhelpful for the average user, stack traces do not point to
    the cause of the failure, but to some symptoms later on.
    
    * Implemented unified pipeline stage result lookup with the new CvPipeline.getExpectedResult() method.
      If the named stage is missing, an Exception is thrown. Any Exception propagated by the result is also properly
      thrown.
    * Created type safe CvStage.Result.getExpectedModel(Class<T>) and CvStage.Result.getExpectedListModel(Class<T>, Exception)
      methods that provide diagnostic model class mismatch and optionally custom empty list Exceptions.
    * Reworked all callers outside and inside the pipeline (stages).
    * Some usages have been made stricter: if a stage name is given, it must now be found (in CvStages this was often ignored,
      with the stage silently doing nothing).

commit 24f3814f2b3e0ea6d847b5fb8101841e3d7431ed
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Thu Jan 14 16:23:02 2021 +0100

    Feature / Actuator Profiles, Camera Lights (#1095)
    
    * * Added Actuator write valueType.
    * Actuator Profiles as a selection of possible Actuator states (multiple choice).
    * Each Profile can set multiple Actuators to specific values.
    * GUI reworked to support value types.
    * HttpActuator extended to support all value types.
    * ScriptActuator extended to support all value types.
    * Added Camera light Actuator.
    * ImageCapture stage can set light actuator value as a parameter.
    * VisionProvider now uses settleAndCapture() instead of sometimes just capture().
    * Various bug-fixes.
    
    * * Actuators have their valueType suggested by functional usage.
    * For backwards-compatibility with established light actuator scripting, allow both Machine and Head actuators for down-looking cameras. Extended ActuatorsComboBoxModel etc. to support this.
    * Migrate typed value Actuator usages.
    * Tested both migration and operation with Bill's extensive machine and GcodeServer simulation to confirm that actuators still work (Gcode log based).
    
    * * silly mistake in comment
    
    * Should also migrate the ActuatorWrite stage value.
    
    * Added buttons to permutate the profiles.
    
    * * Light actuation is broken out from Camera.settleAndCapture, Camera.lightSettleAndCapture is introduced.
    * Camera actuators are always actuated inside Machine task. Not actuated when Machine disabled.
    
    * * Bugfix: do not crash when crop larger than captured (error) image.
    * Undeclared native CvExceptions caught in ReferenceCamera.transformImage(BufferedImage).
    * Switcher camera delivers error image as long as switch does not work (Machine disabled).
    * High quality rendering in pipeline editor MatView.
    
    * * Machine Actuators also need machine coordination options displayed on the Wizard. They may not be
      moved themselves, but they must still be able to (not) coordinate to machine motion, such as the bottom
      camera light actuator to the camera subject (nozzle).
    * Added Camera Light exposure simulation to the ImageCamera and SimulatedUpCamera (while
      also simulating camera lag).
    * Configured light actuators in the SampleJobTest/machine.xml
    * Changed the NullDriver to GcodeAsyncDriver with GcodeServer backend in SampleJobTest/machine.xml
    * Created Machine.execute() to execute tasks immediately, either directly (when already inside
      Machine task) or submit() and wait for completion.
    * Camera light actuators and also the SwitcherCamera actuator are now properly actuated in Machine tasks.
    * Any such execute() will timeout if the machine remains busy for more than a second. So if for
      instance you open the pipeline editor, while a Job is running, the light actuation for ImageCapture is
      rejected, the Job must not be endangered by fluke light actuation. The ImageCapture stage fails.
    
    * * Completely overhauled the Camera broadcasting system.
    * Unified Preview FPS settings across all Camera Implementations.
    * Continuous Preview can be suspended during Tasks/Jobs.
    * SwitcherCamera will never show wrong camera image.
    * Properly associate SwitcherCamera lens calibration and transforms to source analog camera. Source (digitizer) camera is captured raw.
    * Auto-CameraView, Auto-Light triggers Camera.cameraViewChanged() across the system.
    * Made Actuator coordination illegal outside machine task (needed many UnitTest adaptations).
    
    * * Actuator Machine State actuation.
    * Configurable Camera Light Actuator ON and OFF triggers.
    * Improvements from Wiki/PR documentation insights.
    * Cleanup.
    * Extensive Testing.
    * Worked around nasty Unit Testing side effect (property changes not fired?)
    
    * * To prevent common misconfiguration, added assertOnOffDefined()
    * SampleTestJob pipelines were tuned so they will always fail when light is off or settling is faulty.
    * Moved Machine State actuation from AbstractActuator to ReferenceActuator as the former was getting a bit fat and not so abstract.
    
    * * Added CHANGES.md entry.

commit 706729f1c83f52ba8037201e918f2c90419ee5b7
Merge: 5524445f3f c7f0a313e0
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Fri Jan 1 15:41:21 2021 -0600

    Merge branch 'test' into develop
    
    * test:
      - Update CHANGES for this release. - Add UI for Part.pickRetryCount. - Add some missing property change notifications in AbstractFeeder. - Zero out Feeder.pickRetryCount, see CHANGES.
      - Fixes bugs with Feeder.feedRetryCount and Feeder.pickRetryCount that caused them not to be used at all. - Adds new Part.pickRetryCount which wraps the above two and allows for alternative feeders. - Fixes Feeder was not being disabled when it errors. - Adds tests for all of the above. - Note that this branch contains changes to Configuration and Scripting for the purpose of testing that break the UI, and the changes should not be released.
      Refactored out ScriptFileWatcher from Scripting
      scriptDirectory is now passed into Scripting instance
      Moved Scripting to its own package
      - Add a test to check that feeders get disabled when they error.
      - First pass at fixing pick retry. Need to get tests up and running next.
      - When a feeder fails to feed `feedRetryCount` number of times it is now disabled so that the user can continue the job and go to the next feeder that is available for the part. This was part of OpenPnP prior to the JobProcessor rewrite and it got missed. This is partially responsible for https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/issues/1070. It doesn't solve the issue entirely because it should automatically go to the next feeder, but it does partially solve it so it's worth having now, I think.
      - Tests and experiments for fixing pick retry. Started to plan out the concept of a new command based job processor.
      - Small changes throughout the system to make it possible to create a Configuration entirely in memory. These are a little hacky, but don't really harm anything, so probably okay. - Added a pickRetryTest which reproduces the pick retry issue. Next step is to fix it.

commit a2441081782feea422d938cfc1229a1572a1cde4
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Dec 27 22:25:59 2020 -0600

    - Fixes bugs with Feeder.feedRetryCount and Feeder.pickRetryCount that caused them not to be used at all.
    - Adds new Part.pickRetryCount which wraps the above two and allows for alternative feeders.
    - Fixes Feeder was not being disabled when it errors.
    - Adds tests for all of the above.
    - Note that this branch contains changes to Configuration and Scripting for the purpose of testing that break the UI, and the changes should not be released.

115	57	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferencePnpJobProcessor.java

commit 952b1a77aae2aa09b7f10f6049f55083d6193b3d
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Thu Dec 24 10:43:10 2020 -0600

    - When a feeder fails to feed `feedRetryCount` number of times it is now disabled so that the user can continue the job and go to the next feeder that is available for the part. This was part of OpenPnP prior to the JobProcessor rewrite and it got missed. This is partially responsible for https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/issues/1070. It doesn't solve the issue entirely because it should automatically go to the next feeder, but it does partially solve it so it's worth having now, I think.

1	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferencePnpJobProcessor.java

    (cherry picked from commit c144c75b8329c65a42f93098df8c451eda35bf8e)
    
    Feature/Better Backlash Compensation (#1047)
    
    * Removed backlash compensation from GcodeDriver and added it to the Motion Planner.
    * A new BacklashCompensationMethod can now be selected on the axis.
    * Added optimized one-sided backlash compensation that only adds an extra move, if on the wrong side.
    * Added directional backlash compensation that works without extra moves.
    
    (cherry picked from commit 58a54a71d70f6fdb6cdeb34e1eb60dbf148dca15)
    
    Feature/Advanced Motion Control (#1061)
    
    * Make Directional Backlash Compensation one sided too for better compatibility.
    
    * Asynchronous GcodeDriver first steps.
    
    * * Implemented GcodeAsyncDriver.
    * Fixed some Backlash Compensation bugs for the new Directional method.
    * Hide deprecated Gcode commands in the Combobox, if they are not set to a value already.
    
    * * Adding the GcodeAsyncDriver class to the Machine so it can be instantiated.
    * Some bug-fixes.
    
    * Bugfixes, testing with controller.
    
    * First trials with interpolation.
    
    * Fixed Logger thread safety.
    
    * * New GcodeAsyncDriverSettings Wizard.
    * Interpolation settings moved to the GcodeAsyncDriver where they belong, getters return defaults in GcodeDriver.
    * timeoutMilliseconds is stretched to the inverse of the Machine Speed where it matters. So tests with very small speed factors won't timeout.
    * Added ModeratedConstantAcceleration motion control type.
    * Bug-fixes from testing with controller/stepper attached.
    
    * * MotionPlanner class can now be selected in the Machine Wizard.
    * ReferenceAdvancedMotionPlannerConfigurationWizard added, exposing the MotionPlanner as a Wizard page of the machine.
    * Refactored actuator sub-class Wizards to use base class AbstractActuatorConfigurationWizard for common stuff (in preparation to add more common stuff).
    * extracted public method to allow (re-) selection of current object in the Machine Setup Tree, therefore allow loading Wizards with changing set of tabs.
    * moved getMotionPlanner() to Machine interface.
    
    * * Actuator, machine & motion coordination
    
    * * CameraView Zoom increment clipped to >= 1.0 if best scale quality is selected
    
    * * Remodeled ReferenceDriver interface into spi Driver interface and class hierarchy similar to other machine objects.
    * Made interpolation a task of the MotionPlanner, drivers now only execute single moveTo commands.
    
    * * Backlash compensation more robust when settings change during session
    * First steps towards advanced motion planner
    * Support profiles with fused reversing ramps i.e. acceleration != 0 in mid segment
    * Test case reworked
    
    * * Path solver progress.
    
    * * Refactored overshoot control
    
    * * Good working order.
    
    * * Refactored AbstractMotionPath out of MotionProfile to separate path solving from profile solving.

    * OCR settings can be reset to all the BlindsFeeders in the machine.

commit 4450a27df9b52db939aedabda23f431aec12c771
Author: ian-arkver <ian.gh@arkver.com>
Date:   Fri Aug 7 02:43:34 2020 +0100

    Feature/comms fail catch (#1030)
    
    * Add a catcher for GCode driver readLine fail.
    
    WIth TCP communications, if the connection is lost
    Null will be returned. Prevent a NullPointerException
    by not trying to trim() it.
    
    * Catch command write errors, disconnect and disable the machine.
    
    With TCP communications, if the connection is lost, disable the
    machine and mark the connection as disconnected. This allows
    openPnP to reconnect without a restart.
    
    Co-authored-by: Ian Jamison <ian.dev@arkver.com>

15	2	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/GcodeDriver.java

commit 6da40f9141badb27efd79c1faef88f436fda2dea
Author: ian-arkver <ian.gh@arkver.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 16 20:29:00 2020 +0100

    Add Gstreamer Camera (#1023)
    
    This camera uses a textbox to specify an
    arbitrary gstreamer launch pipeline.
    
    Ann appsink is appended to this pipeline and
    samples are pulled and fed to openPnP.
    
    The pipeline should end with an explicit capsfilter
    element.
    
    Co-authored-by: Ian Jamison <ian.dev@arkver.com>

commit 2a6a316cb59883cbc883ac9fb4bda7d903d58e29
Author: doppelgrau <johannes+github@formann.de>
Date:   Sat May 23 04:33:51 2020 +0200

    Feature/new vision stages (#1008)
    
    * New vision stage: MatchPartsTemplate
    
    Added stage for matching multiple rotated rectangles against a template
    image.
    
    * new vision stage: select single rect
    
    selects from a list of rotated rectangles a single one (user defines the
    position)
    
    * missed so include the import
    
    * FileName prefix
    
    If you need to distinguish the templates for different use cases (e.g.
    top/bottom vision), you can now use a prefix.
    
    * To avoid memory leaks, release manually every Mat as far as possible
    
    * Generated missing getter/setter
    
    * Made sure all Mat are released
    
    * removed a bit too much, reverted that change but made sure the Mat is
    released if not returned.
    
    * Typo
    
    * Revert "Merge branch 'fix/ReleaseAllMat' into feature/newVisionStages"
    
    This reverts commit d6f7f109c3aa5d53d3a9e771657266fee153e5a9, reversing
    changes made to f1cab960f62e7f5a3d25ce10fd20c8c47f07ace2.
    
    * Get part information in bottom vision for matching
    
    * return null instead of a exception in the case of an empty list
    
    * fixed initialization of part in bottom vision.
    
    Co-authored-by: Johannes Formann <johannes@formann.de>

    * Cleaned up imports. Handle newly created camera.
    
    * Local mvn test won't report classes you forgot to add to the repo.
    
    * Optimized the settling sequence. Diagnostic image "heat map" rendering and debug file saving is now done after the settle, to make the timing representative.

    * OpenPnpCaptureCamera.internalCapture() spin-loop must timeout to allow for USB disconnects etc.
    
    * Make sure CameraView.showFilteredImage() will immediately display the image even for low or 0 fps cameras.

    * Adapted SimpleGraph usage to the new Nanotime brought in with the Camera Settle code.
    Removed the test graph from the Wizard, as it now can be tested in Camera Settle (even away from machine).
    
    * Integration test on machine. Allow masks to be larger than camera dimension (vignette).
    
    * CHANGES.md
    
    * SimpleGraph Nanotime (theoretical) bug fixed.

commit 4fd4e8ce1aac483cd9a0b73efc87bac4036ef6d0

19	0	CHANGES.md

commit 24a6bce2a9aec102947cebd6f2bc3409c825bb9d
Merge: 59deaa95ce de2d638542
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Mon Apr 20 21:22:54 2020 -0500

    Merge branch 'feature/better-actuator-errors' into develop
    
    * feature/better-actuator-errors:
      Adds several actuatorRead tests, along with a framework for running functional tests with GcodeDriver.
      Finished up the GcodeServer and added the first attempt at a GcodeDriver based test case.
      Merge in the change that added actuatorRead(Actuator, Double) to use a new private method that handles actuatorRead(Actuator, Double) and actuatorRead(Actuator).
      Improves GcodeDriver.actuatorRead to throw errors instead of returning null. This fixes an issue where higher level objects, like vacuum detection, would throw an empty error when null was returned from a read. My reasoning is that if the user (or OpenPnP) is asking for a value from an actuator then it should either get a valid value or it should error. This code still allows for an empty value, e.g. "", but no longer allows for null to be returned. Also adds a basic GcodeServer that will be used in the future to unit test the GcodeDriver.

commit 4283db7588e94e1e047fbd903b939e1995783511
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Apr 19 18:20:59 2020 +0200

    # BlindsFeeder: OpenSCAD File Extraction (#990)
    
    On some platforms (Linux, Debian Buster) the java.awt.Desktop.getDesktop().edit() is not supported, it seems.
    
    This bugfix catches any exception and continues to extract the second file. It reports the error to the user.
    
    See also:
    https://groups.google.com/d/msg/openpnp/Ew7drDA3J60/a-XU02moDAAJ

12	1	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/feeder/wizards/BlindsFeederConfigurationWizard.java

commit 44df65decc449ed4eeb8c8927a9db7b6064ed7d9
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Apr 19 18:20:43 2020 +0200

    # Z-Probe reading conversion error handling (#989)
    
    User might create and set a Z Probe actuator just to see what happens (I did).
    If you leave its GCodeDriver ACTUATOR_READ_REGEX empty, it will return a null String on read.
    Much later your LocationButtonPanel.captureCameraCoordinatesAction will "inexplicably" stop working i.e. a cryptic NullPointerException stack trace is displayed.
    This fix adds an Exception message pointing to the Z probe and conversion error.
    See also:
    https://groups.google.com/d/msg/openpnp/Ew7drDA3J60/kwVUS_FnAwAJ

9	1	src/main/java/org/openpnp/util/Cycles.java

commit ce654ca8c47c022605ca1706cd9b629c068640fd
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Fri Apr 17 05:53:30 2020 +0200

    Feature/ReferencePushPullFeeder (#977)
    
    * First Version of the ReferenceGestureFeeder.
    
    * Due to
    
    https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/commit/61ef27ebd64fe358291034cb84338e029e0c8574
    
    there are exceptions, when pressing the tool capture button. No messageBox is displayed, it just silently fails.
    
    ```
    Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0" java.lang.Error: Cannot call invokeAndWait from the event dispatcher thread
    at java.awt.EventQueue.invokeAndWait(EventQueue.java:1331)
    at java.awt.EventQueue.invokeAndWait(EventQueue.java:1324)
    at javax.swing.SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait(SwingUtilities.java:1353)
    at org.openpnp.gui.components.LocationButtonsPanel$2.lambda$0(LocationButtonsPanel.java:230)
    at org.openpnp.util.UiUtils.messageBoxOnException(UiUtils.java:97)
    at org.openpnp.gui.components.LocationButtonsPanel$2.actionPerformed(LocationButtonsPanel.java:223)
    ```
    
    The camera capture works, because it is inside a `UiUtils.submitUiMachineTask()`.
    
    It seems logical to capture coordinates inside the machine tasks. The machine might theoretically be in the middle of a driver.moveTo() when you press the button and you could get only half updated axes.
    
    Therefore all buttons were changed over to `UiUtils.submitUiMachineTask()`.
    
    * Added Auto-Setup and reworked vision calibration. Fixed LocationPanel bug (accepted as separate PR #957).
    
    * Reworked the feeder to global transforms, with visual offsets.
    
    * Renamed to Push-Pull
    
    * First stab at automatic, statistics driven vision operation.
    
    * Fixes / improvements after machine testing, round two.
    
    * Reworked transformations. Added feeder clone. New machine test.
    
    * Improved Smart Clone.
    
    * Added the new pipeline stages AffineWarp and SimpleOcr.
    
    * * Some refinements in the SimpleOcr and AffineWarp stages, working with proper LengthUnits.
    * Add LengthUnit mouse coordinate display in the pipeline editor
    * prevent huge images from being generated (e.g. by mistakenly changing from millimeters to meters)
    
    * Some work on Ocr integration.
    
    * Added RegionOfInterest and GUI RegionOfInterestProcess to setup. Added OCR drawing.
    
    * Straggler
    
    * Added OCR Font and Font size to feeder wizard, so it can be setup without Pipeline knowledge.
    
    * Further work with OCR bulk operation.
    
    * * Add no-safe-z actuator button.
    * Add tape specification to Package
    * Add swap feeder and create new feeder OCR actions
    
    * Support swapping out feeders while travelling along them.
    
    * New, more transparent cloning.
    AffineUwarp.
    
    * Bug-fixes and improvements from machine tests.
    
    * Better icons for process activity indicator.
    
    * Extensive tests on machine, including AffineWarp / Affine Unwarp for FiducialLocator and BottomVision.
    
    * Added reporting to OCR actions.
    
    * Changes due to OpenCV 4.3 release.
    
    * Broken out #981, remove this here (hope for git to untangle that).
    
    * Broken out https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/pull/980 , removed here. Hope for git to untangle properly.
    
    * forgot to remove one import.
    
    * Broken out https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/pull/982 and removed here.
    
    * Broken out https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/pull/983 and removed here.

    The BlindsFeeder should only use a free nozzle (no part loaded) to open the cover. (#979)

commit 4fe9349d991150e5bea2973f81396c40e6fc5587
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Wed Apr 15 03:33:10 2020 +0200

    Nozzle Offset Wizard optional Z offset (#947)
    
    * * Added a "Include Z?" checkbox (default off), to prevent people from capturing the Z offset of the mark down on the table, which will usually result in a head crash later.
    * Guide text added.
    * Swapped around the two last steps, I think that was wrong.
    
    * * added Warning
    * instead of setting the Nozzle Z offset to 0, it should be reset to the old Z value, already stored there
    
    * * Buffer new offsets until Apply is pressed
    * Adjust Safe Z if Z is included
    * Hide Z fields if Z is not included
    * Added firePropertyChange()s to prevent lost updates if both the "Configuration" and "Offset Wizard" form pages of the Nozzle are opened and modified (both have the headOffsets and safeZ properties buffered)
    
    * * initialize mark location so it will work with manual interaction
    * added Decoraters
    * enlarged fields for larger/negative Millimeter numbers from 5 to the standard 10 units

commit bd3a78a5f2890aa430858fed540963a5797cc93e
Author: Thomas Langaas <thomas.langaas@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 13 00:09:30 2020 +0100

    Adds support for vacuum / blow level
    
    If set on the part's package vacuum level and / or blow level
    will be used in pick and place operations instead of just using
    on / off.
    
    Changes Package and Nozzle, in addition to adding support in
    the neoden4 driver:
    
    The neoden4 has individual (per nozzle) support for vacuum / blow
    level, this is meant to be used per part to unsure proper pickup
    and proper place (some parts needs a bit of air to be released
    from the nozzle).

commit de54e679eaa37d86da4592c4f84ce9a4f0793e47
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sat Feb 29 18:59:12 2020 +0100

    Due to (#957)
    
    https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/commit/61ef27ebd64fe358291034cb84338e029e0c8574
    
    there are exceptions, when pressing the tool capture button. No messageBox is displayed, it just silently fails.
    
    ```
    Exception in thread "AWT-EventQueue-0" java.lang.Error: Cannot call invokeAndWait from the event dispatcher thread
    at java.awt.EventQueue.invokeAndWait(EventQueue.java:1331)
    at java.awt.EventQueue.invokeAndWait(EventQueue.java:1324)
    at javax.swing.SwingUtilities.invokeAndWait(SwingUtilities.java:1353)
    at org.openpnp.gui.components.LocationButtonsPanel$2.lambda$0(LocationButtonsPanel.java:230)
    at org.openpnp.util.UiUtils.messageBoxOnException(UiUtils.java:97)
    at org.openpnp.gui.components.LocationButtonsPanel$2.actionPerformed(LocationButtonsPanel.java:223)
    ```
    
    The camera capture works, because it is inside a `UiUtils.submitUiMachineTask()`.
    
    It seems logical to capture coordinates inside the machine tasks. The machine might theoretically be in the middle of a driver.moveTo() when you press the button and you could get only half updated axes.
    
    Therefore all buttons were changed over to `UiUtils.submitUiMachineTask()`.

2	2	src/main/java/org/openpnp/gui/components/LocationButtonsPanel.java

commit 7d547377d979ddbfa8cb5859dcfc11a147567628

commit 45bf82958afb57c4da4dbd430fe0b9f64cd8cd83
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Tue Jan 28 15:03:55 2020 -0600

    Improves GcodeDriver.actuatorRead to throw errors instead of returning null. This fixes an issue where higher level objects, like vacuum detection, would throw an empty error when null was returned from a read. My reasoning is that if the user (or OpenPnP) is asking for a value from an actuator then it should either get a valid value or it should error. This code still allows for an empty value, e.g. "", but no longer allows for null to be returned.
    Also adds a basic GcodeServer that will be used in the future to unit test the GcodeDriver.

61	31	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/GcodeDriver.java
6	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/spi/Actuator.java
96	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/util/GcodeServer.java

commit 472aeead7c4b5182d98c7f1944ac21766245ea1a
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Wed Jan 22 17:37:36 2020 +0100

    Added more "job like" behaviour to the manual feed operation.
    * The one feeder is prepared, like all of them would in a Job.
    * You can now switch on automatic NozzleTip change on manual feed in the "Tool Changer" wizard of the Nozzle.
    * If enabled, the nozzle tip is automatically changed for one that is compatible with the package in the feeder.
    * The vacuum check is also done.

commit bc953efa5fa275e2b1171ad4a34245636f20f0ea
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Jan 19 23:13:48 2020 -0600

    ReferenceFiducialLocator now returns the location correctly in the case of board bottoms with width set. Previously it returned the newly calculated origin without respect to the width, so the resulting location was off by the width even though the affine transform was correct.
    JobPanel now sets the board location after a manual fiducial check.

commit 0113eaed56dcfa0770158c5b008ea12e93e0974c
Merge: 0d96c9556b 27b87f05dc
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Jan 19 22:45:33 2020 -0600

    Merge branch 'feature/board-location-tests' into develop
    
    * feature/board-location-tests:
      Removed the bottom warning as this is now working for all cases.
      Converted calculateBoardPlacementLocationInverse to use AffineTransform in all cases, like calculateBoardPlacementLocation and removed the secondary calculateBoardPlacementLocationInverse which is no longer needed.
      Added full test suite for calculateBoardPlacementLocationInverse and fixed the bugs that it uncovered. That function now works properly for all cases.
      Removes second variation of calculateBoardPlacementLocation which is no longer needed. Also removes a test that was using it. This test is now covered well in the new set of tests.
      Changes calculateBoardPlacementLocation to use affine transforms in all cases. When none is set, one is created. The purpose of this change is to eventually remove the calculateBoardPlacementLocation that takes width as an argument to unify the code and reduce the number of variations that need to be tested.
      * Adds tests for every permutation of the two calculateBoardPlacementLocation calls. This is the first step to unifying those two methods and converting the entire system to AffineTransform.

commit 08441907bc0218aa8273c8857f2eb6590504fa74
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Mon Jan 20 01:10:19 2020 +0100

    New proper Feeder.prepareForJob() implementation, that actually exploits the Travelling Salesman optimization.
    Cover actuation will now always load a pushing NozzleTip if needed. In case of a feed(), the previously loaded
    NozzleTip will be immediately restored. This should only happen in very rare and exceptional cases, as the
    covers will usually all be opened on job start.

commit f52c32bc7a770b0a5800218736eaed18f9a93450
Author: tonyluken <50550971+tonyluken@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 8 12:12:58 2019 -0600

    Pull in latest changes from openpnp (#3)
    
    * Switch the vacuum valve independently using the actuator inside Nozzle.isPartOff().
    
    ReferencePnpJobProcessor.Place.checkPartOff() currently uses Nozzle.pick() and Nozzle.place() for valve switching.
    
    https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/blob/fee9728215b6174da838a636539370c401a2287c/src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferencePnpJobProcessor.java#L781-L790
    
    This assumes that PICK_COMMAND / PLACE_COMMAND only contains G-Code to actuate the valve. That may not be true for users that add additional G-Code under the assumption that a “pick” really is a “pick” and not just a valve actuation.
    
    E.g. my machine performs a Z-probe, valve actuation, dwell, slow (relative) retraction sequence there. I guess other users might have similarly elaborate pick and/or place commands.
    
    This proposal actuates the valve inside Nozzle.isPartOff() using the already existing vacuum actuator (currently only used for reading) for switching the valve independently. It uses the ACTUATE_BOOLEAN_COMMAND in order to switch the valve. This addition is also useful for the user to experiment with the valve and vacuum levels, using the Actuators tab and buttons in the Machine Controls.
    
    NOTE: For the Nozzle.pick() and Nozzle.place() the valve still needs to be actuated using the PICK_COMMAND / PLACE_COMMAND G-Code as it may be embedded in the middle of the G-Code sequence. In other words Nozzle.pick() and Nozzle.place() do not actuate the Actuator.
    
    * Cosmetic change to use the local instead of member variable.
    
    * Created new ContactProbeNozzle subclass and ContactProbeNozzleWizard.
    
    * New spi.Nozzle moveToPickLocation() and moveToPlacementLocation() methods for override in subclasses.
    * ContactProbeNozzle overrides these to add contact probing on the Z down move.
    * The probe is a boolean Actuator. True means probing to the contact, False means probing away.
    * Vacuum valve can be actuated using Actuator.
    * Driver pick() place() and PICK_COMMAND and PLACE_COMMAND could be removed in the future. For now I left it in, as I'm not sure how other drivers (Neoden4) can handle it.
    * isPartOn() and isPartOff() are enabled individually, if the vacuum level thresholds are set. So users can skip the isPartOff() check to safe time.
    
    * BREAKING CHANGES: Vacuum Valve and Pump, Z-Probing, Camera Lights Actuators.
    * removed pick() and place() methods from the drivers.
    * removed GCodeDriver PICK_COMMAND/PLACE_COMMAND fragments.
    * Nozzle pick() and place() methods now handle the full action:
       - move and lower the nozzle to the pick/place location
       - actuate the valve Actuator which
       - retract the nozzle after the pick/place
    * vacuum pump added to Head, actuated by Actuator
    * valve actuation in turn actuates the pump if needed
    * removed GCodeDriver PUMP_ON_COMMAND, PUMP_OFF_COMMAND.
    * adapted testing to new actuator based picking/placing (as much as I understand)
    * added Camera light Actuator
    * changed all Wizard Actuator references into ComboBoxes for easy selection
    * BUGFIX: machine panels selectedTool notification type cast exception (actuators)
    
    THIS IS WORK IN PROGRESS.
    
    Open Questions:
    * How and where to actuate the camera lights with and without settling?
    * Should the machine panel selectedTool ComboBox also react to newly created/deleted Actuators?
    
    * * mvn test and bugfixes.
    
    * Reverted the camera light actuator
    
    * Some cleanup and added ActuatorsComboBoxModel to ReferenceAutoFeeder.
    
    * removed unnecessary cast
    
    * Enhance Add pipeline with scaling on each stage
    
    * Simple text changes to address things I found ambiguous when starting
    with OpenPnP
    
    * Simple text changes to address things I found ambiguous when starting
    with OpenPnP
    
    * Show the limit being crossed
    
    * Reverting this change so I can have a base branch
    
    * git is hard
    
    * Adds scripting event Job.Placement.Starting
    
    * Missed change
    
    * Add BeforeDiscard event
    
    * Added scripting support to discards made via GUI
    
    * Added pipeline stage to write actuators
    
    Signed-off-by: Jarosław Karwik <jkpublic@kartech.biz>
    
    * Update GcodeDriver.java
    
    Add MOVE_TO_COMPLETE_COMMAND to separate the move command from the wait for completion command.  Allows simultaneous moves across multiple drivers.
    
    * Bottom fiducial check fix
    
    Possible solution to bottom fiducial check bugs 819 and 904
    
    * Update ReferenceFiducialLocator.java
    
    Clean up implementation.
    
    * Update ReferenceFiducialLocator.java
    
    Removed unused logger import
    
    * Correction
    
    Removed logger from wrong file
    
    * Update ReferenceFiducialLocator.java
    
    Fixes panel fiducial check for bottom side boards.
    
    * Fixes #909 / #911 by using JTable.getRowCount() rather than TableModel.getRowCount(). The former takes filters into consideration while the latter always returns the total number of rows in the model.
    
    * Create FUNDING.yml
    
    * getting rid of toolchanger config backward compatibility due to issue #913
    
    * Remove duplicated vision offset correction
    
    getPickLocation() is using visionLocation value to calculate pick location. visionLocation already contains value that was previously corrected in updateVisionOffsets().
    
    * Restored old pick() and place() semantics:
    * Methods pick() and place() will not do the move to and away from the pick/place location, instead the job processor does it.
    * No feeder parameter to pick() needed.
    * ContactProbeNozzle does probing in overrides of pick() and place()
    * No special Z motion is involved, we simply assume the user to be responsible to capture part/PCB Z heights where the probe is not yet triggered.
    * Special feeder approach motion will be solved later.
    
    * BREAKING CHANGE: removing legacy drivers
    This is part of #859. By breaking this into a separate PR I hope to simplify the #859 diff.
    
    * Removed type cast error in machine controls "nozzles" change listener.
    
    * Reverted some OpenPNP-formatter whitespace artefacts to simplify diff.
    
    * Added support for Smoothieware position reporting. Smoothieware includes both the "ok" M114 acknowledgment and the position report on one line.
    
    * Remove visionOffsets from ReferenceStripFeeder as it's no longer used.
    
    * * Added CHANGES.md entry
    * Allowed for deprecated GCode fragment migration
    
    * Minor copy updates in CHANGES and addition of ReferenceStripFeeder update.
    
    * Renamed vacuum sense actuator to vacuum actuator to better reflect it's dual role.
    Changed the name of the Part Detection panel to Vacuum, since that's all it is.
    
    * Add note about backwards compatibility.
    
    * MaskHsv can alternatively create true binary masks to recognize any color except the masking color e.g. even black parts can be recognized in front of a green background.
    
    * Add method to determine whether a HeadMountable location is inside soft-limits.
    
    * * divide Lengths
    * derive and unit-adapt another partial Location to one
    * bugfix in Ransac if the indicesOnLine turns out empty
    
    * Spelling error in comment.
    
    * New vision stages:
    * stages/CreateShapeTemplateImage.java

    * Add Marek's SizeCheck stage: https://groups.google.com/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/openpnp/PoWL_jL_O_Y/D4WJEDj0AQAJ

commit 1d244d9c38ae77726958f75440dfe65e81bfacd6
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Wed Nov 20 16:24:32 2019 +0100

    Restored old pick() and place() semantics:
    * Methods pick() and place() will not do the move to and away from the pick/place location, instead the job processor does it.
    * No feeder parameter to pick() needed.
    * ContactProbeNozzle does probing in overrides of pick() and place()
    * No special Z motion is involved, we simply assume the user to be responsible to capture part/PCB Z heights where the probe is not yet triggered.
    * Special feeder approach motion will be solved later.

    Improvements to MaskHsv

commit 377c0b6e1bbde687e10089791c4dd41389148365
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Mon Jun 24 22:34:45 2019 +0200

    BREAKING CHANGES: Vacuum Valve and Pump, Z-Probing, Camera Lights Actuators.
    * removed pick() and place() methods from the drivers.
    * removed GCodeDriver PICK_COMMAND/PLACE_COMMAND fragments.
    * Nozzle pick() and place() methods now handle the full action:
       - move and lower the nozzle to the pick/place location
       - actuate the valve Actuator which
       - retract the nozzle after the pick/place
    * vacuum pump added to Head, actuated by Actuator
    * valve actuation in turn actuates the pump if needed
    * removed GCodeDriver PUMP_ON_COMMAND, PUMP_OFF_COMMAND.
    * adapted testing to new actuator based picking/placing (as much as I understand)
    * added Camera light Actuator
    * changed all Wizard Actuator references into ComboBoxes for easy selection
    * BUGFIX: machine panels selectedTool notification type cast exception (actuators)
    
    THIS IS WORK IN PROGRESS.
    
    Open Questions:
    * How and where to actuate the camera lights with and without settling?
    * Should the machine panel selectedTool ComboBox also react to newly created/deleted Actuators?

commit 0cdbf5825711e402643cd443608586484e946aa3
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Jun 23 23:22:16 2019 +0200

    Created new ContactProbeNozzle subclass and ContactProbeNozzleWizard.
    
    * New spi.Nozzle moveToPickLocation() and moveToPlacementLocation() methods for override in subclasses.
    * ContactProbeNozzle overrides these to add contact probing on the Z down move.
    * The probe is a boolean Actuator. True means probing to the contact, False means probing away.
    * Vacuum valve can be actuated using Actuator.
    * Driver pick() place() and PICK_COMMAND and PLACE_COMMAND could be removed in the future. For now I left it in, as I'm not sure how other drivers (Neoden4) can handle it.
    * isPartOn() and isPartOff() are enabled individually, if the vacuum level thresholds are set. So users can skip the isPartOff() check to safe time.

commit 44ad98d8c66338558c616b33e7eda7f61bdd9996
Merge: 855b6fe821 b1733d1cec
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 12 22:37:02 2019 -0500

    Merge branch 'feature/switcher-camera-2' into develop
    
    * feature/switcher-camera-2:
      Switcher camera working well! Fixed an NPE in camera view selection management.
      * Added Camera.captureForPreview() which performs a capture and transform, but does not execute scripts, and will not control lighting. Added a default implementation that calls safeInternalCapture and transformImage. This function will eventually be used to differentiate between images being captured for vision using capture() and images for display to the user using captureForPreview(). * Added Camera.captureRaw() which performs a raw capture from the camera. Transforms, scripting, lighting, etc. are all skipped. This is intended to be as close to the hardware as possible. Added a default implementation that calls safeInternalCapture. This will be used in cameras that require images from other cameras to operate. * Refactored transformImage out of most of the camera implementations and moved it into captureForPreview() for DRY.

commit b1733d1cec02c780fa9b32a6f9e0396d7c03503d
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 12 22:36:19 2019 -0500

    Fixed an NPE in camera view selection management.

commit 9f98019b69c0761f2714cd58fe618aae99f3e63d
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Tue Jun 11 21:56:41 2019 -0500

    * Added Camera.captureForPreview() which performs a capture and transform, but does not execute scripts, and will not control lighting. Added a default implementation that calls safeInternalCapture and transformImage. This function will eventually be used to differentiate between images being captured for vision using capture() and images for display to the user using captureForPreview().
    * Added Camera.captureRaw() which performs a raw capture from the camera. Transforms, scripting, lighting, etc. are all skipped. This is intended to be as close to the hardware as possible. Added a default implementation that calls safeInternalCapture. This will be used in cameras that require images from other cameras to operate.
    * Refactored transformImage out of most of the camera implementations and moved it into captureForPreview() for DRY.

commit 0fe9a783e6c90d704f6603f135dac8e37d2b92ce
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Mon Jun 10 13:45:45 2019 +0200

    Switch the vacuum valve independently using the actuator inside Nozzle.isPartOff().
    
    ReferencePnpJobProcessor.Place.checkPartOff() currently uses Nozzle.pick() and Nozzle.place() for valve switching.
    
    https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/blob/fee9728215b6174da838a636539370c401a2287c/src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferencePnpJobProcessor.java#L781-L790
    
    This assumes that PICK_COMMAND / PLACE_COMMAND only contains G-Code to actuate the valve. That may not be true for users that add additional G-Code under the assumption that a “pick” really is a “pick” and not just a valve actuation.
    
    E.g. my machine performs a Z-probe, valve actuation, dwell, slow (relative) retraction sequence there. I guess other users might have similarly elaborate pick and/or place commands.
    
    This proposal actuates the valve inside Nozzle.isPartOff() using the already existing vacuum actuator (currently only used for reading) for switching the valve independently. It uses the ACTUATE_BOOLEAN_COMMAND in order to switch the valve. This addition is also useful for the user to experiment with the valve and vacuum levels, using the Actuators tab and buttons in the Machine Controls.
    
    NOTE: For the Nozzle.pick() and Nozzle.place() the valve still needs to be actuated using the PICK_COMMAND / PLACE_COMMAND G-Code as it may be embedded in the middle of the G-Code sequence. In other words Nozzle.pick() and Nozzle.place() do not actuate the Actuator.

23	4	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceNozzle.java
1	8	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferencePnpJobProcessor.java
