commit 4c03cd6eb43302b66c2f91968c1e8636f31e1813
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Jun 9 16:35:57 2019 +0200

    Like discussed with Jason (earlier in PM) the calibration interface was moved to Nozzle.
    
    All calibration methods are now qualified with the nozzle. This removes an ambiguity for the "unloaded" nozzle tip stand-in, when multiple nozzles are naked.
    
    Reverted the nozzle tip homing, as it is no longer needed. The home() override is now again in the Nozzle and since all calibrations are now properly qualified by the nozzle, multiple nozzles will not reset each other's tip calibrations.

commit d24faea5a34860300011ce13163d250a48ea60a2
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Jun 9 14:08:10 2019 +0200

    In order to recalibrate nozzle tips on homing, we need to get the home() method call to the nozzle tips.
    
    This required adding a home() method to NozzleTip and the home() recursion to AbstractMachine.
    
    The first attempt was adding a machineHeadActivity() machineEnabled() listener. But these are not Exception enabled and we need to be able to throw Exceptions and abort the homing, if calibration is configured as a prerequisite of homing and then fails.
    
    The original PR#825 already added home() recursion into all the HeadMountables for the same reason. This is now actually unused, as the homing has moved from the nozzles to the now global nozzle tips as they are directly attached to the machine. I still prefer keeping the HeadMountable.home() recursion, as a stepping stone to move visual homing from the GCodeDriver (where it doesn't belong) to the down-looking Camera.

7	2	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceNozzleTip.java
9	17	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceNozzleTipCalibration.java
1	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/spi/NozzleTip.java
3	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/spi/base/AbstractMachine.java

commit 22ff6e104fad7c87329f41394f6f515245b7f516
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Jun 9 13:07:23 2019 +0200

    WORK IN PROGRESS:
    
    Nozzle Tips are now global, this also has some impact on nozzle tip runout calibration. Some explanation is needed.
    
    In the physical world, runout can be introduced by the nozzle and/or the nozzle tip. In some machines (e.g. mine), it’s actually the nozzle (more specifically the delicate spring-loaded nozzle tip holder), that has huge runout, not the sturdy CP40 nozzle tips.
    
    As long as we calibrate a nozzle tip each time it is loaded, all that matters is the runout exhibited at the nozzle tip and we need not care where it actually comes from.
    
    However, in order to save job time, PR #825 introduced the possibility to calibrate only once after homing, assuming that unloading/reloading a tip won't rotate it, so the calibration remains valid.
    
    For machines with homed or spring-loaded C axis, the PR even allows to persist the runout calibration. This means runout calibration will add zero time to jobs.
    
    In OpenPNP 1 each nozzle tip was duplicated for each nozzle, so the calibration data was duplicated too, therefore it could correctly capture the combined nozzle + nozzle tip runout.
    
    With global nozzle tips this is no longer true. A multi-nozzle machine could reload the same nozzle tip on a different nozzle, transferring the wrong calibration along.
    
    This commit adds a per nozzle lookup table for the runout calibration. So the nozzle tip can manage calibration for each nozzle separately, while still sharing all the calibration settings and the GUI.
    
    Global nozzle tips also have impact on how they are calibrated when the machine is homed or how calibrations are reset when the machine configuration changes.
    
    This commit is work in progress, as the homing code is currently unattached.

2	20	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceNozzle.java
8	5	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceNozzleTip.java
92	28	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceNozzleTipCalibration.java
12	4	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/wizards/ReferenceNozzleTipCalibrationWizard.java

commit 640d6b37ab43611c296abf174c7d09021ffc8095
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Tue Jun 4 08:34:48 2019 -0500

    * BREAKING CHANGE: NozzleTips have been moved to the machine, rather than existing on each nozzle. You can now manage a set of global nozzle tips and specify which nozzle each is compatible with. In addition, the mapping between packages and nozzle tips has been moved to the package UI, making it much easier to quickly set up a new package.
    * MachineSetupPanel now remembers the last selected tab for a given type of object, so if you are flipping between nozzles, for example, the same tab will remain selected.
    * Laid the groundwork for undoable actions. MainFrame now has an UndoManager, and there is a PropertyEdit UndoableEdit that can be added to it. Added menu items for Undo and Redo. Now just have to rewrite the entire UI to use it!
    * Fixed small bug in deleting packages when multiple packages selected and some are being used by parts.
    * Improved text statuses from job processor to show names instead of ids.
    * Rewrote simple planner to deal with the new nozzle tip system. Works very similarly to the previous one except handles the possibility that a nozzle tip might already be busy.
    * Remove cartesian planner. Don't want to rewrite it for the new system and the simple planner is basically as good, and way faster.
    * BREAKING CHANGE: Calibration is currently broken, will be fixed soon. If you rely on calibration skip this update for a day or two.

    * feature/production-improvements:
      Update changes for removal of paste dispense and placement enabled.
      Removes Placement.Type.Ignore and replaces it's functionality with Placement.enabled. Types of Placement are now Placement and Fiducial, and either can be set to enabled. Board files will be upgraded automatically. Note that if you have placements set to Ignore, they will be changed to type = Placement, and enabled = false.
      Remove the paste dispense feature.

commit 97e5bfc54827965a24eb710fa0932c3cf46ce29f
Merge: b8097ef486 f5e31acf9f
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Mon May 27 16:08:00 2019 -0500

    Merge branch 'feature/production-improvements' into test
    
    * feature/production-improvements:
      * Updated changes for all the new changes on this branch. * The post place vacuum check now turns on vacuum before checking and turns it back off after checking.
      Changed the default error handling mode to alert to more closely mirror previous behavior.
      Brief note for future implementation of the suppress feature.
      * Renamed Feeder.retryCount to Feeder.feedRetryCount. * Added Feeder.pickRetryCount. * Changed hardcoded pick retry in job processor to use Feeder.pickRetryCount.
      Fix tooltips and button names on footprint pads.
      * Removed the post pre-flight nozzle tip calibration from job processor. I can't see why this would be useful since the planner may immediately change out the nozzle tips. Calibration is now performed after tip changes for any tips that are not already calibrated. If you know of a reason this is useful please let me know. * Added error handling system that allows users to specify on a placement by placement basis how errors should be handled. The options are Alert and Suppress. Alert will raise the error immediately the user must fix the problem before continuing. Suppress will mark the placement errored and continue on without alerting the user. When the job finishes the list of errored placements is printed. The user can then fix errors and re-run the job to fix unplaced placements. * Settled on a final class design for the job processor which makes the individual steps very concise and leaves handling completed status and errors to lower level code.
      Encapsulate JobPlacement and add property change support so that status in the UI can be updated on the fly.
      * Remove "Try Again" from job error panel. Now the error is simply shown and the job is paused. The user is expected to fix the problem and start the job again. This is in preparation for being able to set "ignore errors" eventually. * Fix exception type being shown in errors generated with PnpJobProcessorException.
      * Added missing signaler signals for job running and stopped. * IMPORTANT CHANGE: The entire job processor has been refactored to allow for finer granularity in steps, better error handling including the ability to be context sensitive, better retry options for pick and feed failures, improved vacuum checking, and increased flexibility:     * The FSM implemention that caused so many difficult to debug errors has been removed.     * Each step can now be it's own class, and can maintain it's own state. This allows each step to determine it's own level of granularity.     * Steps now direct the job processor to the next step when they finish, making it very easy to add customized steps and to retry when things fail.     * The JobProcessor interface now returns a custom exception type that includes a source. In general these sources will be instances of model or SPI objects such as Nozzle, Feeder, Part, Placement, etc. This makes it possible to help the user find the source of the error in the UI.     * Granularity has been greatly improved in several long running steps. Fiducials, and pick, primarily. Now clicking stop during a fiducial check will not continue checking every board before stopping. * Refactored vacuum sensing to Nozzle.isPartOn() and Nozzle.isPartOff(). This makes it possible to add additional vacuum checks in the job processor. Fixes #753. Fixes #102. * BREAKING CHANGE: Changed the vacuum sensing levels from the trio of logic inverted, part on level, and part off level to a dual range for on low/high and off low/high. * BREAKING CHANGE: Removed job auto save and config auto safe from the job processor. This feature caused a serious performance hit and cluttered up the job processor. Will consider adding this back on a timer external to the job processor. * BREAKING CHANGE: Removed "Check Fids?" from the placements panel, and it's functionality from the job processor. This feature was originally meant to be a way to check local fids around important placements but it was not implemented correctly and was not generally useful. PRs welcome to add true local fid checking. * BREAKING CHANGE: The park when complete option has been removed and park when complete is now always performed. You must set a park location before running a job on this version. This is a preperatory change for more automation in machine movements in general. It will become much more important that the machine knows where it can safely park. * BREAKING CHANGE: Removed the isPartOn and isPartOff variables from the GcodeDriver. This is better handled by the main vacuum system. * Removed Skip and Ignore and Continue from the JobPanel. This is a step in the direction of more automated error handling. Now if there is an unrecoverable error the user is notified of the error and they can either Try Again or Pause. The user can then correct the issue and start the job again. * Driver in demo configuration now moves much faster to make the demo more interesting and faster.
      Increased the speed of the demo driver to make the demo a little more fun to watch.
      BREAKING CHANGE: Removed "Check Fids?" from the placements panel, and it's functionality from the job processor. This feature was originally meant to be a way to check local fids around important placements but it was not implemented correctly and was not generally useful. PRs welcome to add true local fid checking.

commit b8097ef4867bc72e17dd7824ccf3feddea0c0b96
Merge: e6124b1126 f56c3ff0cf
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Mon May 27 16:07:51 2019 -0500

    Merge branch 'develop' into test
    
    * develop: (34 commits)
      Changes ReferenceJobProcessor to pick up at the board where it left off when performing fiducial checks instead of restarting all the checks from the start.
      Change the demo feeder names and layout to be more clear. In feeder panel, moved Part column from 3 to 2 to enforce it's importance over the feeder type.
      Fixes a regression in the LinuxCNC driver that makes it impossible to connect. The bug was introduced in 676f80b5b138d9ad55dfb37e61a64a9ecff9ec84, which did not take into consideration that the connect() method itself calls setEnabled(false) after setting connected = true. The bug was introduced in the OpenBuilds driver but since that one is scheduled for removal and it can be mitigated by setting connection keep alive I'm not fixing it.
      Updated default pipeline .xml files for maskHsv changes
      Added invert flag and a commit method
      Fix an issue where manually setting a board location after running a fiducial check would not reposition the placements. The affine transform was not being cleared when setting a new board location.
      one more ucase remove
      Add missing hint on button in pipeline editor. Removed some Ucase chars.
      Corrected comment.
      Corrected logic in maskHsv when hueMin > hueMax.  Also added descriptions to each of the maskHsv properties.
      Removed useless code
      open csv file as ISO-8859-1 to allow the use of 8 bits ascii char.
      Enhanced error message
      Initialize CVPipelineEditor with last stage selected and stage grid focused.
      fix NullPointer exception when there is no "results" stage in the  nozzle calibration  pipeline
      Fix Cast exception when the "results" stage is disabled in a pipeline. Instead show a more comprehensive dialog
      Edited CHANGES.md
      Fixes an issue where closing a dialog would leave the job panel unresumable. Thanks @Marek!
      added test buttons for autofeeder actuators
      ScriptAction class added to support biding hotkeys to script events.
      ...

    * Removed the post pre-flight nozzle tip calibration from job processor. I can't see why this would be useful since the planner may immediately change out the nozzle tips.     * Added error handling system that allows users to specify on a placement by placement basis how errors should be handled. The options are Alert and Suppress. Alert will raise the error immediately the user must fix the problem before continuing. Suppress will mark the placement errored and continue on without alerting the user. When the job finishes the list of errored placements is printed. The user can then fix errors and re-run the job to fix unplaced placements.
    * Settled on a final class design for the job processor which makes the individual steps very concise and leaves handling completed status and errors to lower level code.

commit 35aa639a874788a1e7cd912544585437325e9578
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun May 26 23:05:32 2019 -0500

    * Added missing signaler signals for job running and stopped.
    * IMPORTANT CHANGE: The entire job processor has been refactored to allow for finer granularity in steps, better error handling including the ability to be context sensitive, better retry options for pick and feed failures, improved vacuum checking, and increased flexibility:
        * The FSM implemention that caused so many difficult to debug errors has been removed.
        * Each step can now be it's own class, and can maintain it's own state. This allows each step to determine it's own level of granularity.
        * Steps now direct the job processor to the next step when they finish, making it very easy to add customized steps and to retry when things fail.
        * The JobProcessor interface now returns a custom exception type that includes a source. In general these sources will be instances of model or SPI objects such as Nozzle, Feeder, Part, Placement, etc. This makes it possible to help the user find the source of the error in the UI.
        * Granularity has been greatly improved in several long running steps. Fiducials, and pick, primarily. Now clicking stop during a fiducial check will not continue checking every board before stopping.
    * Refactored vacuum sensing to Nozzle.isPartOn() and Nozzle.isPartOff(). This makes it possible to add additional vacuum checks in the job processor. Fixes #753. Fixes #102.
    * BREAKING CHANGE: Changed the vacuum sensing levels from the trio of logic inverted, part on level, and part off level to a dual range for on low/high and off low/high.
    * BREAKING CHANGE: Removed job auto save and config auto safe from the job processor. This feature caused a serious performance hit and cluttered up the job processor. Will consider adding this back on a timer external to the job processor.
    * BREAKING CHANGE: Removed "Check Fids?" from the placements panel, and it's functionality from the job processor. This feature was originally meant to be a way to check local fids around important placements but it was not implemented correctly and was not generally useful. PRs welcome to add true local fid checking.
    * BREAKING CHANGE: The park when complete option has been removed and park when complete is now always performed. You must set a park location before running a job on this version. This is a preperatory change for more automation in machine movements in general. It will become much more important that the machine knows where it can safely park.
    * BREAKING CHANGE: Removed the isPartOn and isPartOff variables from the GcodeDriver. This is better handled by the main vacuum system.
    * Removed Skip and Ignore and Continue from the JobPanel. This is a step in the direction of more automated error handling. Now if there is an unrecoverable error the user is notified of the error and they can either Try Again or Pause. The user can then correct the issue and start the job again.
    * Driver in demo configuration now moves much faster to make the demo more interesting and faster.

0	38	src/main/java/org/openpnp/gui/JobPanel.java
27	51	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceNozzle.java
34	45	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceNozzleTip.java

commit 8fbbfe8a654ee3841713df4c2f2651a2bc6d42ac
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun May 26 12:52:42 2019 -0500

    BREAKING CHANGE: Removed "Check Fids?" from the placements panel, and it's functionality from the job processor. This feature was originally meant to be a way to check local fids around important placements but it was not implemented correctly and was not generally useful. PRs welcome to add true local fid checking.
    
    This change should not break any jobs or configurations, but I've labeled it a breaking change to get the attention of anyone who was using the feature for further discussion.

commit 39e504423f79d752182a5f9b51928143281c3ae6
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun May 26 12:19:23 2019 +0200

    Finishing touches after one more thorough machine test.
    * Changing the up-looking camera's position or transformation automatically resets all nozzle tip calibrations.
    * Changing the nozzle tip offset automatically resets all nozzle tip calibrations.
    * Aborting the calibration due to unhomed machine is now an exception instead of silently doing nothing.
    * For camera position and rotation calibration, the nozzle tip must be runout calibrated first.
    * Camera rotation calibration is now also incremental: better results can be achieved by repeating the calibration.
    * Camera calibration excenter ratio can be set in the machine.xml

17	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceCamera.java
2	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferenceNozzle.java

commit 1cf90a9909142697fe683a6092737d31205dac69
Merge: 645c7d31ab 033195cb70
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat May 18 19:43:48 2019 -0500

    Merge branch 'master' into develop
    
    * master:
      Fixes a regression in the LinuxCNC driver that makes it impossible to connect. The bug was introduced in 676f80b5b138d9ad55dfb37e61a64a9ecff9ec84, which did not take into consideration that the connect() method itself calls setEnabled(false) after setting connected = true. The bug was introduced in the OpenBuilds driver but since that one is scheduled for removal and it can be mitigated by setting connection keep alive I'm not fixing it.
      Merge in travis updates from develop.

commit 033195cb70137495e031846ece14fac3df486e61

commit afe112d7d40cadf7d48665b5c7b977a797400b00
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Apr 21 09:14:44 2019 +0200

    First commit.
    * add "Model and Camera" runout calibration where the axis offset is used to determine the bottom camera position and only the actual runout is applied to the nozzle tip
    * allow for a number of vision misdetects to be tolerated
    * add setting for the trigger(s) that require a new calibration (instead of everytime a nozzle changes inside a job)
    * persist runout calibration for machines that home the rotation axis
    * avoid unnecessary rotation moves in calibration
    * unit aware threshold setting
    * ensure proper unit handling in the Model algorithm
    * add Z offset for calibrating nozzle tips where the detected outline might be further up the nozzle tip
    * add pseudo "unmouted" nozzle tip handling to allow runout compensation without tip (also using Z offset)
    
    All work in progress.

commit c0b5b01227f236ac3d9d6a862fae3645e91ac130
Merge: bb5c03521e d4fac19872
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Mon Mar 18 22:29:03 2019 -0500

    Merge branch 'develop' into test
    
    * develop: (103 commits)
      Added a bare minimum pipeline example.
      Fixes override sounds not working for SoundSignaler. Added configuration wizard for SoundSignaler.
      Fixes #814. Home action's icon is now tied to a property which is bound to the machine's "homed" property. Added a few notes for future improvements in the same vein.
      Fix a minor issue in the test driver where getLocation did not apply head offsets. Fix some lint in the ReferenceHead which caused tests failures when the driver was updated at runtime.
      Improved documentation on new planner.
      Minor optimization of the new job planner. Now sorts the remaining placements by number of compatible nozzles to reduce cycles.
      Added a new planner that is faster, but somewhat less "perfect". It performs well on very large jobs. Added a new planner interface.
      Add a unit test for calculate board location that checks with and without affine transform.
      Fixes incorrect Z calculation in placement location for affine transform fiducials.
      Fixes placement and board angle being calculated incorrectly in new fiducial code.
      Update changes for recent changes. Fixes #478. Fixes #278.
      Delete board action now works for multi-select in JobPanel.
      Fixes all the FSM problems in the JobPanel, I think.
      Fixes #278. The JobProcessor now has an opportunity to pause or stop between every step aside from "do nothing" steps. This means that if you start the job and immediately hit pause it will complete the fiducial checks and then stop, rather than perform a full cycle. Note that this change increases the granularity of the step function so that now stepping takes more clicks to do a full cycle, but I think this is a good tradeoff without having to rewrite the entire processor.
      When adding a new placement the side is now set to the board location's side. This ensures the new placement is not filtered out of the table after being added. Fixes exceptions when auto selecting newly added rows. Fixes #643.
      Add multi-select and right click menu to feeders panel. Right click menu allows enable/disable of feeders in bulk. Enabled multi-select for delete action.
      Adds multi-selection and right click menu to the boards table.
      Adds copy/paste of parts in the parts panel.
      Compltes the affine transform fiducial system. Fixes #791 Fixes #649
      This file was previously changed in this branch to support a new option, but I'm not going to expose that option, so reverting this.
      ...

commit 6ec8856de8f50e810c26fa95ed1547e34238aea4
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Wed Mar 13 18:49:34 2019 +0100

    Bottom Vision should store the rotation angle offset in the PartAlignmentOffset.
    
    This way the rotation can be restored when the part is actually placed later. Today the proper rotation is only "stored" in the current C axis rotation. This information is lost with shared C axis heads when another nozzle picks a second part before the first one has been placed. The solution also helps removing Double.NaN from driver workflows.
    
    See also:
    BottomVision Pre-Rotate Fails on Shared C Heads
    https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/issues/599
    
    Remove Double.NaN from Driver workflows
    https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/issues/255
    
    The PR also contains some extensions and cleanup:
    * PreRotate BottomVision is done in a multi-pass loop until a good fix is obtained.
    * X, Y offsets are obtained together with the rotation offset, so with a good fix only one vision pass is needed.
    * X, Y offsets are compensated for rotation.
    * angleNorm() is used instead of duplicated code in findOffsetsPostRotate()
    * a redundant Location.derive() is removed in findOffsetsPostRotate()

55	46	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/vision/ReferenceBottomVision.java
1	1	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/vision/wizards/ReferenceBottomVisionPartConfigurationWizard.java

commit ca3d5426c4d2a33b3a1f5cb1953646861c6b2ae7
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Wed Feb 20 23:27:30 2019 -0600

    Fixes #278. The JobProcessor now has an opportunity to pause or stop between every step aside from "do nothing" steps. This means that if you start the job and immediately hit pause it will complete the fiducial checks and then stop, rather than perform a full cycle.
    Note that this change increases the granularity of the step function so that now stepping takes more clicks to do a full cycle, but I think this is a good tradeoff without having to rewrite the entire processor.

7	7	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/ReferencePnpJobProcessor.java

    When adding a new placement the side is now set to the board location's side. This ensures the new placement is not filtered out of the table after being added.
    Fixes exceptions when auto selecting newly added rows. Fixes #643.

This is   primarily a safety improvement. * Z and Rotation have been removed from the park head configuration since these are each specific   to the tool being parked. * Park Z now parks the selected tool at Safe Z instead of the Z entered in the head configuration. * Park Rotation now parks the selected tool's rotation at 0 instead of the Rotation entered in the   head configuration. * Fixes https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/issues/279

commit c44bb0f2faa0e7351601266f988cdd04505953b2
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Tue Feb 12 20:24:54 2019 -0600

    * Park XY now always parks the head at the same location, regardless of what tool is selected in
      the jog control dropdown. This ensures that if you choose a park location with one tool selected
      and then attempt to park with a different tool selected you don't crash the head. This is
      primarily a safety improvement.
    * Z and Rotation have been removed from the park head configuration since these are each specific
      to the tool being parked.
    * Park Z now parks the selected tool at Safe Z instead of the Z entered in the head configuration.
    * Park Rotation now parks the selected tool's rotation at 0 instead of the Rotation entered in the
      head configuration.
    * Fixes https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/issues/279

      ui propertychange added to autoupdate gui
      fixed whitespaces
      changed measurement angles from 0...360 to -180...+180deg to honor for machines have the +-180 nozzle degree limit activated.
      getLocation is and was ever okay, like it is (it's used for the dros)
      rename debug output prefix
      enabled isHomed-check feature
      readded support for keypoints / simpleblob detector
      formatted calibration information output
      fix angleIncrement calculation and better handle limits (angleStart/stop)
      added a "move nozzle tip to bottom camera button"
      moved NozzleCalibration.Starting event
      reverted angleIncrement enum to double again
      ...

commit c30c2ac8c54dbb3df462ae4e17a976d0801e876e
Merge: d8ea0fdacd bb5c03521e
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Thu Jan 17 23:08:16 2019 -0600

    Merge branch 'test' into develop
    
    * test:
      * OpenPnpCaptureCamera now allows 0 and fractional FPS. * capture() and machine movement will now signal the camera to show a new frame, regardless of the FPS setting.
      Lint
      Removes the broken "maximum FPS" system for continuous capture and now just relies on the camera to send frames as needed. This can be user limited by the FPS setting on most camera implementations. This feature was not used very often, was not well understood, partially broken due to configuration not saving, and was getting in the way of performance.
      Refactor camera configuration wizards to break out properties into multiple sheets. This removes the fragile system where we extended and injected into another wizard and replaces it with smaller, easier to consume forms for specific sections.
      Checkpoint: Removes the FPS stuff and adds support for hasNewFrame. Also changes streamers to get their own thread. This isn't really production, but it's an interesting experiment, and now to switch back to the normal code to see if there is actually any point.

commit 68d09c8c7221666d5c0d98965ba8fbfec01ab221
Merge: 1b4dd6a570 d8ea0fdacd
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Jan 13 19:54:58 2019 -0600

    Merge branch 'develop' into feature/camera_arch
    
    * develop:
      added autosave properties to gui plus info about possible delays
      Added an experimental "auto settle" system to the camera subsystem. By specifying a negative settle time, the auto settle system will be used. The system checks for differences between successive images and only returns an image once there are a minimal number of differences, indicating the camera has stopped moving. The absolute value of the negative value is used as a threshold to reject noise. A good starting point is -128. The more noisy the camera is the higher (or more negative) the threshold must be.
      added Labcenter importer to menu
      adding importer for Labcenter Protues PKP files
      Importer to important Labcenter Proteus PKP files
      reverted welcome message
      added Welcome to start message

commit 3135b8305894ba96046fb1e029fcbf698fbe438a
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat Jan 5 23:23:05 2019 -0600

    Added an experimental "auto settle" system to the camera subsystem. By specifying a negative settle time, the auto settle system will be used. The system checks for differences between successive images and only returns an image once there are a minimal number of differences, indicating the camera has stopped moving. The absolute value of the negative value is used as a threshold to reject noise. A good starting point is -128. The more noisy the camera is the higher (or more negative) the threshold must be.

53	6	src/main/java/org/openpnp/spi/base/AbstractCamera.java

Merge: 1694ada660 890fb7413d
Author: smdood <spiteri.michael@gmail.com>

    Update JobPlacementsPanel.java

commit 890fb7413d9da7129b6ee5c126ff0976fb9608db
Author: smdood <spiteri.michael@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 2 21:57:47 2018 +1100

    Update JobPlacementsPanel.java
    
    Change the functionality of the Move camera to next placement button.
    Old behavior: The camera would move to the current location and the highlighted part would move to the next part.
    New behavior: The highlighted part is moved and then the camera is moved to its location.
    This way, the part in the camera view and the part highlighted in the parts list are the same. Then if you adjust the placement, when you press the "Set placement to current camera location" etc the correct part will be edited instead of the next part in the list.

4	4	src/main/java/org/openpnp/gui/JobPlacementsPanel.java

3	1	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/openbuilds/OpenBuildsDriver.java

commit 676f80b5b138d9ad55dfb37e61a64a9ecff9ec84
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Tue Sep 18 20:35:11 2018 +0200

    OpenBuildsDriver, GcodeDriver and LinuxCNC disconnect when disabled.
    
    This allows for a serial port to be reused in another program (i.e. Pronterface) or unplugged, or the controller reset without closing OpenPNP. If the serial port becomes available again, the machine can be enabled again and the connection succeeds.
    
    Before this change this failed at least under Windows where a COM port name is blocked until explicitly closed by the process. Even resetting/re-plugging the controller will not free the port and also not reestablished the connection. OpenPNP has to be closed and the controller reset/re-plugged one more time, before a freshly started OpenPNP can reconnect.
    
    When closing OpenPNP the user loses the GUI navigation which is very annoying when editing Gcode fragments. Along with Gcode editing, users may need to change config.txt on Smoothieware controllers, which requires a reset of the controller. Which again (at least on Windows) was only possible after exiting OpenPNP.

3	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/openbuilds/OpenBuildsDriver.java
3	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/GcodeDriver.java
3	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/LinuxCNC.java

commit c8a22d5f9f1dcae1c308246671a838c3181c97b5
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Mon Sep 17 22:49:59 2018 +0200

    Handled NaN coordinates if force-included.

63	38	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/GcodeDriver.java

commit f8c9f2d06aca57fd841761ebf99bd842525c5c49
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Sep 16 09:33:36 2018 -0500

    Adds a OffsetTransform to GcodeDriver that can be used to trick OpenPnP into working with Shared C machines. See https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/openpnp/CA%2BKNHNxW4vE_rvi7MSLvnhsiw4BAE0xyJN%2BeEP%3D5dq5x45WHEA%40mail.gmail.com?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer for details.

29	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/GcodeDriver.java

commit 48f8336d5fc43e0bdd2bc0c0c009471929e5480f
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Sun Sep 16 15:47:21 2018 +0200

    Add new Gcode MOVE_TO_COMMAND variables XF, YF, ZF, RotationF for forced coordinate output even if the coordinate has not changed on the internal Axis.
    
    This may be employed for shared axes, where OpenPNP cannot not keep track of when an axis has physically moved behind its back through a shared axis. Consequently getCoordinate() may not reflect the actual physical coordinate. By always forcing the axis coordinate output, the controller will take care of restoring the shared axis' correct position, if necessary. As we are always moving in absolute coordinates this has no ill effect if it results in no position change after all.
    
    Note there is no need for separate backlash compensation variables, as these are always substituted alongside.

46	5	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/GcodeDriver.java

commit 0a8cdf13f7065c747a352e0983c3a6b26de5fe88
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat Jul 21 15:23:24 2018 -0500

    Fixes a number of issues with the new tcp/serial code where disconnect() was not called during shutdown, resulting in an unclean shutdown.
    Renamed and moved a few classes and methods to more closely adhere to the previous code.
    Changing the communications type now forces a disconnect so that the new communications type can immediately be connected.
    Removed a few unused attributes from the communications interface. Line ending looks like it was intended to be user exposed, but that doesn't work in interfaces, so need to revisit that as it's a good feature.

To activate, need to set checkbox in machine settings. - Some changes in job order. Now user can change job order by sorting table. - Job autosave after each placement. - Added peel off actuator option for Drag Feeder. - Drag Feeder improve accurance of feed, now drag distance can be addaptive with vision enablde. - Drag Feeder can work with 0402.

    - Filter PlacementsTableModel, show only active board side.

    - Camera window can be split in vertical or horizontal style

    - Added peel off actuator option for Drag Feeder.
    - Drag Feeder improve accurance of feed, now drag distance can be addaptive with vision enablde.
    - Drag Feeder can work with 0402.

Merge: a0f20c858e 9926a99e74

commit a0f20c858ea95c34e8a17603f89c13c5a3279d97
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Fri Apr 27 15:30:33 2018 +0200

    The internal X coordinate set after homing is not compensated for non-squareness after homing to non-zero Y. The non-squared machine X is used directly. This results in incorrect coordinates displayed immediately after homing. When capturing these coordinates and returning to them, you will observe an offset, as is most obvious with a homing fiducial.
    
    This commit fixes that.
    
    See also:
    https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/issues/724

45	14	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/GcodeDriver.java

commit 9926a99e74a183a831bb8805540a7b878f3ab9a5
Author: markmaker <mark@makr.zone>
Date:   Fri Apr 27 15:30:33 2018 +0200

    The internal X coordinate set after homing is not compensated for non-squareness after homing to non-zero Y. The non-squared machine X is used directly. This results in incorrect coordinates displayed immediately after homing. When capturing these coordinates and returning to them, you will observe an offset, as is most obvious with a homing fiducial.
    
    This commit fixes that.
    
    See also:
    https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/issues/724

      added option to ignore while feeding. added canIgnoreContinue
      added option to ignore error in state align (bottom vision). the user can just continue as if everything would be right.
      Update README.md
      Allowing users to override the default sounds of the sound signaler by putting files in the configuration/sounds directory There are two files which can be replaced and need to be wav files: "error.wav" and "success.wav". Place them in the OpenPnP configuration directory under sounds e.g. "~/.openpnp/sounds/success.wav" or "C:\Users\maeckle\.openpnp\sounds\success.wav"
      ...

commit 54dea10c94d6c5a727999e506b0726cd59a3f839
Author: Friedrich Mäckle <maeckle@nantis.de>
Date:   Wed Dec 6 12:21:32 2017 +0100

    Allowing users to override the default sounds of the sound signaler by putting files in the configuration/sounds directory
    There are two files which can be replaced and need to be wav files: "error.wav" and "success.wav". Place them in the OpenPnP configuration directory under sounds e.g. "~/.openpnp/sounds/success.wav" or "C:\Users\maeckle\.openpnp\sounds\success.wav"

commit 0d482c113a1e720d9c4aa410aa8d8791cd44488d
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Thu Oct 26 01:12:02 2017 -0500

    * ReferenceLoosePartFeeder now shows camera output at the end of the process, instead of during. This gives the user better feedback on the final decision when picking a part.
    * ReferenceLoosePartFeeder now takes it's location's rotation into account when returning results. The rotation is added to the vision rotation. This allows you to further set the orientation you want a part picked in.
    * Removed the ReferenceLoosePartFeeder experimental warning. It's working pretty well now!
    * Added new OrientRotatedRects stage.
    * Updated ReferenceLoosePartFeeder's default pipeline to better recognize rectangles for resistors and capacitors.
    Ref #666

commit 49fe40f84a2367bb8072ee46c10d30483fe89715
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 25 17:02:07 2017 -0500

    * CvPipeline editor now has rudimentary model identification in the results panel. If you mouse over an object that is reflected in the results and the object can be recognized, it's description will be shown. Currently works for Circles, KeyPoints, RotatedRects and Lists thereof. Eventually this will be expanded to include bounding boxes, but right now it just looks for the mouse to be within 5 pixels of the center of the object.
    * DrawRotatedRects now copies the input model to it's output, which is helpful for the above. Other stages will likely follow suit.

Author: Richard Sim <rsim@devras.com>
Date:   Mon Sep 4 00:36:39 2017 -0700

    - Added odd-numbers-only check to BlurMedian to avoid OpenCV assertion

2	1	src/main/java/org/openpnp/vision/pipeline/stages/BlurMedian.java

commit 3d65abbedf97169c38d04e92479960d59c840112
Author: Richard Sim <rsim@devras.com>
Date:   Mon Sep 4 00:04:15 2017 -0700

    Improvements to ReferenceStripFeeder's pipeline and Auto Setup:
    - Auto Setup: The best-fit line of holes for Auto Setup is now taken as the longest line that is within our desired distance ranges rather than the closest, as that would often get influenced by falsely detected circles, and there should only ever be one (long) line of holes anyway. Both works better and makes more sense.
    - Auto Setup: The detected holes are now fitted to what we expect their perfect locations/spacing to be along the best-fit line. This stops them being heavily affected by not-so-consistent circle detection in the pipeline, improves the stability of the results, and as a side benefit really highlights when the tape isn't at the same height that the camera's units-per-pixel were configured for (as the resulting holes are spaced at exactly 4mm, and you can see them offset from the detected holes)
    - Pipeline: Another pass at a one-size-fits-all pipeline for ReferenceStripFeeder. Tested and proven quite reliable on white tape, black tape, and even transparent tape(!)

53	11	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/feeder/wizards/ReferenceStripFeederConfigurationWizard.java
28	1	src/main/java/org/openpnp/model/Location.java
20	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/vision/FluentCv.java
5	4	src/main/resources/org/openpnp/machine/reference/feeder/ReferenceStripFeeder-DefaultPipeline.xml

commit 7f400b24d614bb723ffca07ae68c2aba46c67e3b
Merge: 9988f97bbf 9a4d00d876
Author: Richard Sim <rsim@devras.com>
Date:   Sun Sep 3 16:57:28 2017 -0700

    Merge branch 'ReferenceStripFeeder-Improvements' of https://github.com/richard-sim/openpnp into ReferenceStripFeeder-Improvements
    
    * 'ReferenceStripFeeder-Improvements' of https://github.com/richard-sim/openpnp:
      - Changes to the ReferenceStripFeeder default CvPipeline to improve detection accuracy with real-world cameras (works with the simulated camera too) - Added descriptions for some Hough circle parameters - Exposed the threshold/detection related parameters from DetectFixedCirclesHough, as only the feature size ought to be fixed - Added odd-numbers-only check to BlurGaussian, to avoid an assertion in OpenCV. Matches the assertion (and description) in ThresholdAdaptive for blockSize.

commit 9988f97bbfd9e238b5f632bfee06cda73abb5cd1
Author: Richard Sim <rsim@devras.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 30 21:30:11 2017 -0700

    - Changes to the ReferenceStripFeeder default CvPipeline to improve detection accuracy with real-world cameras (works with the simulated camera too)
    - Added descriptions for some Hough circle parameters
    - Exposed the threshold/detection related parameters from DetectFixedCirclesHough, as only the feature size ought to be fixed
    - Added odd-numbers-only check to BlurGaussian, to avoid an assertion in OpenCV. Matches the assertion (and description) in ThresholdAdaptive for blockSize.

3	0	src/main/java/org/openpnp/vision/pipeline/stages/DetectCirclesHough.java

3	2	src/main/resources/org/openpnp/machine/reference/feeder/ReferenceStripFeeder-DefaultPipeline.xml

commit 9a24aa5277fff77e577e5a422d29da30a1bc7cd4
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Sep 3 14:45:13 2017 -0500

    Change reference strip feeder setup to clone the pipeline before use. This is a (maybe temporary) hack to avoid a number of concurrent modification exceptions. The cause is that findHoles and showHoles are being called concurrently (one from the camera thread and one from the UI thread) and are stomping all over each other's use of the pipeline.

12	7	src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/feeder/wizards/ReferenceStripFeederConfigurationWizard.java

Author: Richard Sim <rsim@devras.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 30 21:30:11 2017 -0700

    - Changes to the ReferenceStripFeeder default CvPipeline to improve detection accuracy with real-world cameras (works with the simulated camera too)
    - Added descriptions for some Hough circle parameters
    - Exposed the threshold/detection related parameters from DetectFixedCirclesHough, as only the feature size ought to be fixed

commit ca7141ee8ff5581df79e2f42b9ed578157396f23
Merge: 728cf626ec f9a53f0f1d
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Tue Aug 29 11:41:29 2017 -0500

    Merge branch 'richard-sim-ReferenceStripFeeder-Improvements' into develop
    
    * richard-sim-ReferenceStripFeeder-Improvements:
      Minor updates and cleanup. Result image is now based on original, rather than modified.
      Updated CHANGES.md document for the PR
      Corrected getHoleDistanceMax() to match EIA-481.
      Missed than an auto-generated method didn't follow the style guidelines!
      Addressing issue #411, Strip Feeder Auto Setup Improvements - Auto Setup for ReferenceStripFeeder is now a lot smarter, more accurate, and is able to catch common setup issues - Fixed issue where strips with 2mm part pitch could result in the reference holes being detected flipped depending on where on the two parts the user clicked - Fixed issue where part pitch was calculated in the units of the camera, not necessarily millimeters - User is notified if they selected parts in the wrong order for the orientation of the strip (ReferenceStripFeeder.getPickLocation() can be updated to handle this if we want, since we can detect it after all) - Tightened the max distance from a component center to the feed hole centers to accurately reflect the spacing as defined in the T/R standard and thus reduce false-positives for adjacent strips - Multiple, full lines of strip holes are detected and grouped appropriately, and only the correct line of holes are used for the selected parts/strip (some spacing is still required between adjacent strips, but it is much reduced and more reliable)
      Added auto-thresholding to the default CvPipeline for ReferenceStripFeeder to better detect tape holes and eliminate false-positives in noisy camera images

6	2	src/main/java/org/openpnp/vision/Ransac.java

commit 751173605c7956e3972df42fb40a08b47ce3073f
Author: Richard Sim <rsim@devras.com>
Date:   Sun Aug 27 21:39:24 2017 -0700

    Addressing issue #411, Strip Feeder Auto Setup Improvements
    - Auto Setup for ReferenceStripFeeder is now a lot smarter, more accurate, and is able to catch common setup issues
    - Fixed issue where strips with 2mm part pitch could result in the reference holes being detected flipped depending on where on the two parts the user clicked
    - Fixed issue where part pitch was calculated in the units of the camera, not necessarily millimeters
    - User is notified if they selected parts in the wrong order for the orientation of the strip (ReferenceStripFeeder.getPickLocation() can be updated to handle this if we want, since we can detect it after all)
    - Tightened the max distance from a component center to the feed hole centers to accurately reflect the spacing as defined in the T/R standard and thus reduce false-positives for adjacent strips
    - Multiple, full lines of strip holes are detected and grouped appropriately, and only the correct line of holes are used for the selected parts/strip (some spacing is still required between adjacent strips, but it is much reduced and more reliable)

commit 31aa32dded863e08e0cf2f432cb2514c9246572a
Merge: d21c4e0cce d50a085257
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Wed Aug 16 19:42:10 2017 -0500

    Merge branch 'richard-sim-ReferenceStripFeeder-CvPipeline' into develop
    
    * richard-sim-ReferenceStripFeeder-CvPipeline:
      Reset to correct commit
      Removing (now) unused classes to keep the PR clean, as they're available in the history for if/when we need them later
      Restored alphabetical order for the list of Stages - oops (was lost in a rename of the new stage)
      - Reverted DetectCirclesHough to avoid messing with adding Units support to the pipeline at this point in time - Added a fixed-function DetectFixedCirclesHough stage that is configured by the pipeline (ReferenceStripFeeder only for now). Works in pixels now also, as RSF does the conversion instead.
      DetectCirclesHough is no longer coupled to requiring a camera to be set on the pipeline, and maintains backwards compatibility (defaulting to using pixels for measurements) for any exiting users of the feature. Unit-based measurements can still be used optionally, if a camera is set.
      Stage 2 of adding CvPipeline to ReferenceStripFeeder, as per #330: Completely convert the vision system to use the CvPipeline. * No longer relies on old FluentCv-style pipeline * Implemented similarly to ReferenceLoosePartFeeder as far as what's in the CvPipeline vs what's in code * DetectCirclesHough now uses Length for distances and sizes, so they have units as opposed to being in pixels, which neither matches the old behaviour nor is portable across different machines * PipelinePanel's PropertySheetPanel now supports editing of Length types (other custom types can be easily added likewise) * During the feeder setup wizard, the circles debug colors have been slightly changed (an additional color is used, nothing has been lost), as follows:   * Red are any holes that are found.   * Orange are holes that passed the distance check but failed the line check.   * Blue are holes that passed the line check but are considered superfluous.   * Green passed all checks and are considered good.
      Stage 1 of adding CvPipeline to ReferenceStripFeeder, as per #330: Add pipeline for pre-processing the image, allowing it to be cleaned up for improved recognition by the current algorithm. Stage 1 would allow the user to configure steps to clean up the image in their Machine.xml file, but still use the current recognition code on the cleaned up image.

    add Check Box "Use only Value as PartId", ...
    
    both boxes unchecked by default
    
    Part ID should be a primary key from a company internal data base.
    Therefore mixing up value and package isn't of any help.

commit c7d16678085dc31b680c7bad72d6ca8fa3224e38
Author: Richard Sim <rsim@devras.com>
Date:   Fri Jul 28 23:36:00 2017 -0400

    Stage 2 of adding CvPipeline to ReferenceStripFeeder, as per #330: Completely convert the vision system to use the CvPipeline.
    * No longer relies on old FluentCv-style pipeline
    * Implemented similarly to ReferenceLoosePartFeeder as far as what's in the CvPipeline vs what's in code
    * DetectCirclesHough now uses Length for distances and sizes, so they have units as opposed to being in pixels, which neither matches the old behaviour nor is portable across different machines
    * PipelinePanel's PropertySheetPanel now supports editing of Length types (other custom types can be easily added likewise)
    * During the feeder setup wizard, the circles debug colors have been slightly changed (an additional color is used, nothing has been lost), as follows:
      * Red are any holes that are found.
      * Orange are holes that passed the distance check but failed the line check.
      * Blue are holes that passed the line check but are considered superfluous.
      * Green passed all checks and are considered good.

commit 2cf2de08cf485d9a69e3501f15c885e8b388a925
Author: yaddatrance <kenson@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 27 20:42:14 2017 -0700

    Added keyboard hotkeys for some common functions.
    
    I am building a control panel for my system with jog wheels and buttons
    which will use a virtual HID keyboard interface.
    
    Ctrl-Shift-R: Starts a job
    Ctrl-Shift-S: Steps through the job
    Ctrl-Shift-A: Stops the job
    Ctrl-Shift-P: Parks head (Z retract then XY park)
    Ctrl-Shift-Z: Moves head to safe Z
    Ctrl-Shift-D: Discard component
    Ctrl-Shift-F1: 0.01mm jog increment
    Ctrl-Shift-F2: 0.1mm jog increment
    Ctrl-Shift-F3: 1mm jog increment
    Ctrl-Shift-F4: 10mm jog increment
    Ctrl-Shift-F5: 100mm jog increment

commit 8f77166eda88399733c326fdac36cc51cdb57a83
Merge: e1fd27b001 fc08fc6a9d
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 28 22:39:10 2017 -0500

    Merge branch 'develop' into feature/fid-pipeline
    
    * develop:
      Finish merge of CvPipeline variables in code that had not yet been migrated.
      Remove dead comments. Add some handy getters and setters in prep for variable support.
      Checkpoing from last night. Adds all the neccesary support to add variables to pipelines via commons beanutils PropertyUtils.getProperty(). The idea is to add a new variableOverrides map to CvStage which will be used to apply a variable to a specific property. This map will be managed from the UI, requiring changes to the property editor component. This will allow us to keep the strongly typed properties but override them with variable values when needed.

      Improved LoosePartFeederPipeline.xml with drawing of delivered model

      Added logging to the `ClosestModel` stage
      ...

commit c9331d08804676c054a00beff7b7faba1ae0a6a4
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Mon Jun 26 10:57:56 2017 -0500

    Checkpoing from last night. Adds all the neccesary support to add variables to pipelines via commons beanutils PropertyUtils.getProperty(). The idea is to add a new variableOverrides map to CvStage which will be used to apply a variable to a specific property. This map will be managed from the UI, requiring changes to the property editor component. This will allow us to keep the strongly typed properties but override them with variable values when needed.

commit c3a901981c6f5621a49c06f84d9e84adf3683218
Author: Friedrich Mäckle <maeckle@nantis.de>
Date:   Sun Mar 26 17:12:00 2017 +0200

    Removing the AutoScroll Setting and Changing AutoScroll behaviour
    Behaviour of Scrolling now: If scrollbar is at maximum AutoScrolling is enabled, if not it should stay where it is, but due to a problem with i guess the data binding the list will jump to the top
    The Button was changed to scroll to the end of the List
    
    The AutoScroller class was derived from: https://tips4java.wordpress.com/2013/03/03/smart-scrolling/ by Rob Camick, following the about page no attribution is required: https://tips4java.wordpress.com/about/

commit 1a04f64330df148ce2ff29bc2764c87c564c6f2c
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Wed Mar 22 19:16:09 2017 -0500

    Fixes #477, if Test Alignment is clicked and either global bottom vision or part bottom vision is not enabled a warning is shown and the operation is aborted. Root cause of issue is that the test alignment code expects the bottom vision routine to have moved the nozzle over the camera already, but if it's not enabled it doesn't run. We skip the move to safe Z on the test code because moving to safe z after the alignment and before centering is an odd user experience.

commit 813094453d2f8ca76a78f28f05080581c6987383
Author: Friedrich Mäckle <maeckle@nantis.de>
Date:   Sun Mar 12 13:10:58 2017 +0100

    Adding more functionality to the Logging Panel
    
    * General Changes
    
    - Adding a ConsoleWriter which will print to the original stdout stderr PrintStreams, removing this in the new SystemLogger
    - Changing LogPanel to a rendered JList which is now filterable and has references to the original LogEntries
    - Removed Line Limit, lines limited to 10k entries in the LogEntryListModel
    
    * UI Changes
    
    - Split Global Settings and Filter Settings into two Panels
    - Changing popup menus to select boxes for logging levels
    - Removed toolbar elements in Logging (not floatable anymore), replaced by Panels
    
    * Custom Filters
    
    - Adding a Search TextField, searches full error message, case insensitive
    - Adding a Checkbox to enable System.out and System.err
    - Adding a button to enable auto scrolling on the LogPanel
    - Adding a button Copy to Clipboard of filtered Items

commit e8f1065dd7ba2ceb4f2f915e5b0f8ecee6080edf
Author: Friedrich Mäckle <maeckle@nantis.de>
Date:   Sun Mar 12 13:10:58 2017 +0100

    Adding more functionality to the Logging Panel
    
    * General Changes
    
    - Adding a ConsoleWriter which will print to the original stdout stderr PrintStreams, removing this in the new SystemLogger
    - Changing LogPanel to a rendered JList which is now filterable and has references to the original LogEntries
    - Removed Line Limit, lines limited to 10k entries in the LogEntryListModel
    
    * UI Changes
    
    - Split Global Settings and Filter Settings into two Panels
    - Changing popup menus to select boxes for logging levels
    - Removed toolbar elements in Logging (not floatable anymore), replaced by Panels
    
    * Custom Filters
    
    - Adding a Search TextField, searches full error message, case insensitive
    - Adding a Checkbox to enable System.out and System.err
    - Adding a button to enable auto scrolling on the LogPanel
    - Adding a button Copy to Clipboard of filtered Items

commit 47932eff9afee5c46ab18512a4984fa6a8b426e1
Author: Friedrich Mäckle <maeckle@nantis.de>
Date:   Wed Mar 1 13:53:49 2017 +0100

    Adding a SystemLogger class for redirecting stdout and stderr to tinylog
    
    Class was named SystemLogger because tinylog uses reflection and the class name will be used for tagging the LogEntry
    
     Unfortunately there is no generic log function where one could pass a LogLevel, therefore it is used in the constructor of the SystemLogger to be evaluated on logging.

    * feature/#399-slotted-feeders:
      Part change now updates the apply button.
      Everything now working except updating the table when part is changed.
      Add changes.md for the slot feeder.
      Implemented delete bank and feeder buttons. I think we're done!

      Feeder can now be set to null, i.e. unloaded.
      Offsets working correctly now.
      Offsets now basically working, but the pick location doesn't apple immediately to the offsets. Checking this in before I screw it up while trying to fix that.
      Default bank is now named Default. Changing name of bank or feeder reflects immediately in the combo.
      Slot feeder setup all working now aside from delete buttons. Need to refresh combos when name changes.
      Renamed to SlotAutoFeeder. Like that better at the moment. Rearranged wizard a bit, added offsets fields but didn't hook them up. Not crazy about how it looks.
      Slot feeder bank and feeder stuff now working pretty well. There are still some issues: * Need to kill part binding in abstract wizard. It's overriding our part. Probably just need to dump the abstract wizard. * Need to be able to configure feeder offsets. Maybe move feeder below bank and that will leave more space for feeder specific properties.
      Slot feeder work: * Added configuration wizard and started building it out. * Fixed the config loading issue. Everything now serializes properly.
      Checkpoint on slot feeder code. Added a machine properties feature that allows storing of arbitrary objects on the machine. Used to store the banks for this feature, but will be helpful for other features in the future.
      Checkpoint - working out the model of the new feeder.

      Update changes for previous commit.
      Add a new scripting example that searches board locations for a QR code and disables the board in the job if any are found. Add the zxing barcode libarry to the distribution. Add a simple qr code read function in VisionUtils to make it easier to read a barcode.

commit a86978e206fc61bdc23f9b4be72db8eb22a04d16
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Thu Dec 22 16:07:28 2016 -0600

    Nav view now maintains a historical bounding box for zoom instead of updating based on current extents. This makes it so that when you move objects around you don't lose access to the area they previously occupied. The idea is that as objects move around the entire machine extents can be understood.

Merge: bd20790a7d 4bae83019b
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Tue Dec 20 17:14:32 2016 -0600

    Merge branch 'develop'
    
    * develop: (24 commits)
      Playing around with making nav view nodes double click to zoom.
      Add changes for release. Fix NPE when initializing footprint views with null footprints.
      Nav panel no longer requires -DenableNav. Instead it detects if JavaFX is installed and automatically shows it if so.
      Add some camera image null checks to handle cases where camera drivers return null images.
      Update CHANGES.md with change to nozzle tips.
      Revert "Try to fix caching issue at Github"
      Try to fix caching issue at Github
      Fix icon sizes.
      Added nozzle specific add and remove icons to make machine setup a bit more clear. Actions are now shown in machine setup in reverse order so that the icons to the left are always the most specific.
      Add/remove nozzle tips now, too.
      Added support for nozzle and actuator add/remove from machine setup.
      * Machine Setup now monitors for changes in children and attempts to refresh the nodes. This doesn't work perfectly yet, but it's an improvement and allows for dynamic updates such as adding feeders, cameras, etc. * CamerasPanel (from tabs at bottom) has been removed and it's functionality moved to the Machine Setup tab. * Cameras can now be added and removed without restarting OpenPnP. * Name and Looking properties added to camera wizard. These were previously settable in the table, but the table has been removed, so now they are fields on the wizard. * Auto generated action methods removed from cameras to allow the actions from the ReferenceCamera through. This enables the delete action in Machine Setup. * Minor refactoring and improvements.
      More nav view selection stuff.
      Playing around with bidirectional selection between the tables and the nav view.
      Nav View: * Fix bug where zoom was not set correctly on scene bounds. * Add tooltip to camera.
      Mostly nav view code cleanup. All components now control their own location and update it when needed.
      Add a simple event bus. Currently using it to decouple navigation view but intended to be used for more events going forward - especially scripting events.
      Drag jogging now shows line immediately. Added back shift-click to jog. Some people might miss it and there's no harm in leaving it in.
      More nav view stuff.
      Lots of code cleanup and refactoring on nav view.
      ...

commit 83d4a0da601db53be9fb293f1e15c4c4c1dc9e33
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Dec 18 10:57:31 2016 -0600

    * Machine Setup now monitors for changes in children and attempts to refresh the nodes. This doesn't work perfectly yet, but it's an improvement and allows for dynamic updates such as adding feeders, cameras, etc.
    * CamerasPanel (from tabs at bottom) has been removed and it's functionality moved to the Machine Setup tab.
    * Cameras can now be added and removed without restarting OpenPnP.
    * Name and Looking properties added to camera wizard. These were previously settable in the table, but the table has been removed, so now they are fields on the wizard.
    * Auto generated action methods removed from cameras to allow the actions from the ReferenceCamera through. This enables the delete action in Machine Setup.
    * Minor refactoring and improvements.

commit 4f086bfd5e2bbe934b2af7699b11b830539bc887
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat Nov 26 12:15:13 2016 -0600

    Added an event mechanism to the scripting system. It is now possible to call Configuration.get().getScripting().on("event", Map<String, Object> globals) to fire a pre-defined script. This is intended to be used in further changes that support user defined scripts for system events such as picking, placing, camera capturing, etc.

commit 1b09002ba5021bb357e6ac1f777504961324e289
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat Nov 26 10:28:33 2016 -0600

    Added a new createDefaults() method to the ReferenceDriver interface which is used by the UI to create defaults for a new driver.
    Added defaults as above so that the GcodeDriver starts with a basic, sane set of commands that people can modify.
    As a side effect of above, we no longer create axes on empty drivers, which is important now that we are pulling axes from sub-drivers for getLocation().
    Removed the deprecated junk from GcodeDriver - it's been long enough now that no one should still have an old config.

commit 72ac8a54a9b39abe41e61bada80cc09c26e59807
Author: Dave P <dave_prosee@hotmail.com>
Date:   Sat Nov 26 15:43:56 2016 +0100

    DRO update corrected when using Gcode driver with axes on subdriver
    
    Location info is retrieved not only from the main Gcodedriver but also
    from subdrivers. There is no need to tweak machine.xml anymore. The only
    axes needed for a main/subdriver need to be defined on that driver. See
    also issue #376

    has an action to do.

    Hence give original input.

Merge: c0c222edac d538999436
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Thu Nov 17 18:34:33 2016 -0600

    Merge branch 'feature/vacuum-sense' into develop
    
    * feature/vacuum-sense:
      Finished up the vacuum sense code, and tested it fully. Added zoom to camera view. Updated CHANGES.md with all the recent changes.
      Change the vacuum levels to be used for part on and part off: Vacuum level is expected to be >= vacuumLevelPartOn after a pick and <= vacuumLevelPartOff after a place. Removed the default vacuum levels as these are pretty machine specific. Added the values to the wizard so they can be configured from the UI.

commit 75ca28930bda250c55b25edc4a20f605c2be4689
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Thu Nov 17 10:12:20 2016 -0600

    Change the vacuum levels to be used for part on and part off: Vacuum level is expected to be >= vacuumLevelPartOn after a pick and <= vacuumLevelPartOff after a place.
    Removed the default vacuum levels as these are pretty machine specific.
    Added the values to the wizard so they can be configured from the UI.

      Add SLF4j-log4j back in as removing it seems to have broken the WebcamCamera.

      Fixes #354, adds a fourth move to the nozzle tip changer. The additional move is placed in the middle and for backwards compatibilty it will be cloned from the previous middle move upon first config load.

      Update CHANGES.md
      Updates changes for recent changes.
      Fixes #333, logging is now handled by tinylog and uses a very simple default configuration. Log level can be managed in the log tab. Logs are captured to rotating files, similar to before, to the log window and to the console.
      Ripped out slf and log4j and replaced with tinylog + a small wrapper. Wrapper is just so I don't have to touch every class yet. Will be removed. Logging window now controls logging entirely.
      Fixes #347, camera view reticles now track the tools rotation, instead of the camera's rotation.
      Fixes #352, strip feeder now treats feedCount 0 as feedCount 1 for the purposes of returning pick location.
      ...

    log4j:WARN See http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/faq.html#noconfig for
    more info.

    Caused by: com.lti.civil.CaptureException:
    java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no civil in java.library.path

    returning to Cameras panel and selecting it:
    The vonnieda.org Java video capture kit is unable to load it's native
    layer.
    Please make sure you have org_vonnieda_vfw_CaptureDevice.dll in
    yourPATH, Windows directory or current directory.
    If you do not have this file, you should be able to find the latest
    version at http://www.vonnieda.org/software.html.
    Load failed due to:
    java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no org_vonnieda_vfw_CaptureDevice in
    java.library.path
    camera’s are not updated to the machine setup tree, you have to reload
    and crashes the app.
    
    The remarks however, I cannot relate to the changes made. Hence still a
    commit and PR.

Date:   Mon Sep 5 13:37:08 2016 -0700

    Fixes #335. This should resolve a whole host of issues people are having with fiducials and the two point location process. Primary fix is that ideal locations are now calculated with board location set to 0, and we use the actual calculated ideal board locations as our baseline.
    Adds a new test that runs 100k random boardlocations through the new process.

    * 'develop' of https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp:
      Adds move-to-complete-regex, see https://github.com/openpnp/openpnp/wiki/GcodeDriver#move-to-complete-regex

      OpenBuilds driver now normalizes angles to 0-360 and shortcuts long rotations by going the opposite direction when needed.
      Formatting.
      Added hardcoded alignment check for OpenBuilds driver. Not to be merged into main.
      New travis from develop to keep things in sync. Upgrades install4j and should not deploy feature branches.

commit b7a8ff47b80964263f4c3a379a270660af9268af
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat May 14 18:41:11 2016 -0700

    Treat all E moves in OpenBuilds driver as solo. There doesn't seem to be any way to convince Smoothie not to truncate E moves for small linear moves, so we have to do this or we don't know where E will end up.

    Merging some standalone features and code from the job processor refactor:
    Adds crop to camera base. Fixes #171.
    Shows camera names in the All Cameras view. Makes it easier to identify what you are looking at. This is always on right now, might need to be an option if it bothers people.
    Removed the dead bottom vision API from VisionProvider. This was no longer used now that the bottom vision system is complete.
    Adds the ability to limit FPS in the OpenCvCamera. This is an easy way to decrease CPU load. I've found even 5 fps is more than enough.

commit 5d0534ac7d334a61fad32b382e6f683858b1dbc8
Merge: 7c85d2b09f 7797154c52
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Mon Apr 25 22:30:32 2016 -0700

    Merge branch 'develop' into feature/jobprocessor-refactor
    
    * develop: (154 commits)
      Add a new Median Blur CvStage. StandaloneEditor now adds an ImageRead stage on init so that the file selector has something to input to.
      Update changes for bottom vision.
      ImageWriteDebug now respects the debug flag.
      Label updates on the bottom vision config wizards.
      Test alignment button now centers over camera after alignment and a checkbox is added to turn that off. Both are useful during setup.
      Remove the return to original location from discard. It was usually a waste of time.
      Add test alignment button to part bottom vision config.
      Fix test failing to load default pipeline xml.
      Move default pipeline into an XML resource file.
      Per Part PartAlignment configuration now supported. ReferenceBottomVision now has a per part alignment configuration wizard which lets you set a unique pipeline per part or reset to default. ReferenceBottomVision config wizard now lets you reset the default pipeline to the built in pipeline and reset all part specific pipelines to the default. Added a safe clone() to CvPipeline, uses serialize / deserialize to make sure no state is shared.
      Removes the obsolete FirePick driver. Fixes #262.
      Reworks packages panel and parts panel code to be a little more generic. These share a lot of code so now the variables are named the same. Parts panel now split like packages panel to allow for per part configuration. First will be alignment, up next. Fixed divider location not saving in packages panel and added it for parts panel.
      Updated CHANGES.md for previous commit. Remove stopship from the auto feeder. It's still not done but for some reason it's triggering the hook when it didn't before. It's okay for it to be in the codebase for now.
      Added scrollpane to footprint editor. Fixes #260.
      Minor jog controls UI tweaks. Pretty happy with it now.
      Get rid of the oversized start/stop button. Now fits nicely in the UI and isn't jarring. Red still grabs your eye enough that you can find it quickly.
      Move jog controls back to main window. Integrate start/stop button into jog controls to save vertical space. Add start/stop to menu because why not. Fixes #222.
      Move jog increments into jog controls panel in preparation for moving the jog controls panel into the main window.
      Added a CHANGES.md which will track important changes chronologically. Changed Nozzle.pick() to Nozzle.pick(Part) and updated all instances to use it. This is required for some of the other changes below. Removed the Pick and Place buttons from the Special Commands window. These were extraneous now that we have various Part included Pick operations and the Discard operation. May consider adding these back in some form if there is an uproar. Removed the reecently added Align button from the Parts panel. This was not well thought out and will be included in the Bottom Vision specific configuration area. Added a Pick button to the Parts panel. This allows you to pick a given part using the first available feeder. Fixed incorrect speed handling in OpenBuilds driver. Nozzle.moveTo and Nozzle.moveToSafeZ now respect Part.speed if a Part is currently picked. This allows this speed limit to be handled in one place instead of all over the app. Added Nozzle.getPart() which returns the Part currently picked or null if none is picked.
      Added a new button to the parts panel for testing / setting up bottom vision for a part. The button causes the machine to pick the part from the first available feeder and perform part alignment on it.
      ...

commit 39ff815d4116314957b638eda6e99c67b7db1d53
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat Apr 23 15:09:54 2016 -0700

    Added a CHANGES.md which will track important changes chronologically.
    Changed Nozzle.pick() to Nozzle.pick(Part) and updated all instances to use it. This is required for some of the other changes below.
    Removed the Pick and Place buttons from the Special Commands window. These were extraneous now that we have various Part included Pick operations and the Discard operation. May consider adding these back in some form if there is an uproar.
    Removed the reecently added Align button from the Parts panel. This was not well thought out and will be included in the Bottom Vision specific configuration area.
    Added a Pick button to the Parts panel. This allows you to pick a given part using the first available feeder.
    Fixed incorrect speed handling in OpenBuilds driver.
    Nozzle.moveTo and Nozzle.moveToSafeZ now respect Part.speed if a Part is currently picked. This allows this speed limit to be handled in one place instead of all over the app.
    Added Nozzle.getPart() which returns the Part currently picked or null if none is picked.

commit 18fbd95c663d909e569457ca3d71cf9501aea565
Merge: 91319f579b 949da1817c
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Apr 10 12:21:26 2016 -0500

    Merge branch 'develop' into feature/bottom-vision
    
    * develop:
      Release Mats used during camera lens calibration in LensCalibration. Fixes #252
      Added a couple of missing Mat release() calls that are in #256
      Use initUndistortRectifyMap to precompute the lens distortion map. Fixes #229. The undistortion maps are lazily computed as they are each the size of the frame and thus are too big to be saved with the calibration.
      In ReferenceCamera#transformImage, adjust the size of the image before rotating so that the full rotated image will fit in the new frame. Fixes #228

      Added a couple of missing Mat release() calls that are in #256

commit c53483fb36f2a66cc3b42630c4816a1697cc03c9
Merge: e4037b5a65 ebdef2b425
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Apr 10 12:20:46 2016 -0500

    Merge branch 'develop' into feature/gcode_driver
    
    * develop:
      Add Id and Name variables to all Gcodes that were missing it. Add True and False variables to actuateBoolean. These can be used with arbitrary format strings to produce any value. True is only rendered if the value is True, False is only rendered if the value is False. Removed BooleanValue from actuateBoolean as it's better handled by the new True and False variables which can product any value, not just 0 and 1. Example: S0 F{True:1}{False:0} will produce "S0 F1" for a true value, "S0 F0" for a false value.
      - Add an IntegerValue variable to GcodeDriver's actuate(boolean) command, requested by alex: https://groups.google.com/d/msg/openpnp/n0B_xnzGFYA/81GCgnbaIgAJ - Add a Name variable to GcodeDriver's pick and place commands, to allow the nozzle to be identified.
      Fix several OpenCV memory leaks. Only initialize nav view if system property is defined. Should resolve some issues people are seeing on older VMs.
    
    # Conflicts:
    #       src/main/java/org/openpnp/machine/reference/driver/GcodeDriver.java

    Merge branch 'develop' into feature/cv-pipeline
    
    * develop:
      Changes the debug output images for template matcher to include information in the filename that helps identify the single run of the function. You can now sort by name to see the files associated with a single run instead of having to try to guess by time.
      Turn off queue reports in TinyGDriver. Send homing command, homing all four axes.
      Reformatted the entire codebase using the current preferred codestyle. This is Google's style with a few simple changes: * Spaces only. * Indent is 4 spaces. * Newlines on if blocks. Included the code style formatter definition for Eclipse.
      Maintenance: Cleaning up imports.
      Fixed a constructor problem on new Webcams class that caused it not to initialize properly. Removed Wide camera from default machine.xml. Was never supposed to be checked in.

      Update WebcamConfigurationWizard.java

      Update ReferenceMachine.java

      Create WebcamConfigurationWizard.java
