commit 431575a1b0f22736a1b9d3b5c71fe356777e647f
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Mon Feb 15 23:25:34 2016 -0800

    Adds replan functionality to JobPlanner and friends. This allows the caller to push a previously planned placement solution back into the queue to try again. More explanation in the comments.
    Update ReferenceJobProcessor to use the new replan functionality and fix a number of issues where showing the user would result in an aborted job.
    The change additionally makes it so that when a feed failure happens the feeder is disabled and the processor tries again. The user is only notified if no feeder is eventually found.
    All in all, this fixes #206.

commit 572f2350ebddb8f6fb74adfccef6de5dbb0bd6ba
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat Oct 3 05:33:12 2015 +0800

    BREAKING CHANGE: Changes the Board.solderPastePads List from Pad to BoardPad, introducing the new type BoardPad which contains a Pad. This is neccesary because Pads may have their own units and may be used outside of a Board. Any board files created with the previous model will need to be re-created, although since no one is actually using this feature yet that should be okay.
    Move convertBufferedImage from OpenCvUtils to ImageUtils to better reflect it's purpose. It is not OpenCv specific at all.
    Configuration now saves any boards referenced by a job when saving the job. Fixes #156.

commit af7da3dbf3b82662aa81ad6fd1c74dde4e0ec5d3
Merge: 616d1b4db7 f329279807
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 21 16:43:04 2015 +0800

    Merge branch 'develop' into feature/machine-setup-icons
    
    * develop:
      Missed the paste dispenser in the head safe z.
      BREAKING API CHANGE: Changes VisionUtils.getPixelCenterOffsets to return offsets using the same signs as the machine coordinate space. This is a direct inversion of how it worked before. This change is annoying, but needed before this function gets used too much more as the results it returned were difficult to understand when trying to ctually use them in the context of a Location. In addition, the function did not return the correct values according to the docs. The docs were correct, the function was not.
      Speling mistake.
      Adds flip horizontal and flip vertical to reference camera and updates all the other cameras to use the transform functions. This is important for bottom vision as the cameras will typically be flipped in at least one axis.
      Changed EAGLE board importer name to be more clear.
      Add stack trace to MessageBoxes when no message is included. Added this to help track down some failures that are being shown to the user without a message.
      Change how camera moves to fids so that it only does safe Z once. This avoid unneccesary movements on machines with moving cameras.

commit 31f69c2f9e1d32621a2789df82fee0957bd8c65f
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Thu Sep 17 23:43:59 2015 +0800

    BREAKING API CHANGE: Changes VisionUtils.getPixelCenterOffsets to return offsets using the same signs as the machine coordinate space. This is a direct inversion of how it worked before. This change is annoying, but needed before this function gets used too much more as the results it returned were difficult to understand when trying to ctually use them in the context of a Location. In addition, the function did not return the correct values according to the docs. The docs were correct, the function was not.
    
    Adds tests for VisionUtils.
    Adds a new VisionUtils.getPixelLocation() which is just a helper for the above.
    Update OpenCvVisionProvider to use the new helper.

      Improve the reference camera configuration wizard to show location for fixed cameras and offsets for moving cameras.

      Minor junk, just need to switch branches.
      Add includePickLocation flag to ReferenceFeederConfigWizard so that we can leave this out for feeders that calculate the pick location based on other parameters. Finished up the strip wizard.

    * feature/paste-dispense: (31 commits)
      Reversing this for now as I want to do some final testing without it before merging.
      Just a note regarding paste dispense parameters.
      Move and capture for BoardLocation now uses either the Nozzle or Dispenser, depending on which job type is selected.
      Forgot to actually call the driver method. Now it does!

      Add dispensers to the jog controls panel. Add dispenser info to the default machine.xml.
      Paste dispenser added to the head. Paste job processor updated to use it. Basic wizard added for setting offsets.
      PasteJobProcessor now uses the Pads instead of bullshit.
      Tests fixed.
      Everything regarding JobProcessor switching basically working. Lots of testing to do.
      Move all the base functionality of the JobProcessor into a base class and update the Reference classes to use the base. Purpose is to simplify the reference classes.
      Stubbed in the new JobProcessor system. Multiple JobProcessors are now allowed and everything at the moment works in fallback-to-pnp mode. Next step is to break everything by binding the JobProcessor at job run time instead of system start time.
      Accidentally used Java 8 ArrayList.sort. Again.
      Add name to pads. Add naming of pads to gerber importer. Convert units of incoming pads to boardLocation units to make it more intuitive for user.
      Add new solder paste layers, exported with the new OpenPnP-EAGLE.cam. Add a new CAM processor for EAGLE / OpenPnP. Update board board with pads.
      Sort the files in the test output to make it a little easier to read.
      Added the skeleton of region support. Added a bunch of statistics to get a better picture of what is actually being used in files in the wild. Answer: Mostly lines.
      Added some sample gerbers and fixed table refresh on import.
      Start building out the actual importer. Fix handling of unknown extended codes.
      Parsing of all example files is now working. Added support for generating pads. Time to test in OpenPnP.
      ...

Merge: c9de70faa3 9aa215fef3

commit c9de70faa3a2c142b79414a4cdf79505f07ff17d
Author: Neil Jansen <njansen1@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu May 21 09:01:43 2015 -0700

    Updates to Marlin Driver. Issuing M999 to reset modular tool issues that may happen if power supply isn't turned on before OpenPnP connects.  This is mainly to get around a Marlin issue that resets the controller if temperature is too high or low.  For FirePick Delta, we will read temperature too high if the module isn't plugged in, or if the ATX power supply isn't turned on.
    
    Also changed the ring light enabling/disabling codes, as I'm no longer using a NeoPixel-style ring light, and am just using a simple red/white LED with PWM.

commit e5449f0e3ec688e92ede824a5e90b1a63d9f4192
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat Feb 7 18:00:46 2015 -0800

    Removes the UI dependency on the various model classes id field and adds a common name field that is editable. IDs are now managed entirely by the application and are intended to be opaque and unique. This is needed to handle the ability to easily add and remove these model objects from their respective lists.

commit 03bae891cb5029b25434950a268a53a5eaf439f3
Author: domonoky <domonoky@googlemail.com>
Date:   Sun Nov 23 17:20:28 2014 +0100

    Enforce Locale.US on many String.formats. Not doing this, cause numbers to be displayed with , instead of . in some locales. And the number parsers can not cope with that and drop numbers after the dot.

commit 26e42f27ea56f98d6b19581aafd8891155036f44
Merge: 4754fee043 08c0e87002
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Tue Jan 21 02:20:12 2014 -0800

    Merge branch 'develop' into importer-refactoring-merge-develop
    
    * develop: (35 commits)
      Documentation updates.
      Got rid of the janky line breaker for error messages and switched to HTML with a fixed width. Looks much better. Added a more informative message for when configuration can’t be loaded.
      Minor cleanup stuff.
      Fixes an offset bug in ReferenceTrayFeeder. Thanks rspelling!
      Minor merge conflicts.
      Added more functionality to the test suite.
      Fixes a few leftover bugs in the GrblDriver.
      Merges Johannes’ change which allows the user to position the camera by clicking the mouse. Merge is made with some modifications: Shift is used instead of Ctrl as Ctrl is the popup modifier on Mac and Windows. Move is made at Safe-Z. Move is made using MachinePanel job queue. Reverses the change of adding the offsets to the Camera, as this would break a great number of things.
      ctrl-click in the camera image to move the head
      Added a basic framework for functional testing and one sample test. Needs work, but very useful already.
      Adds .settings to ignore. Adds a sample unit test in preparation for real unit tests. Updates JUnit version. Fixes a bug in NullDriver that allows functions to run while driver is disabled.
      Cleaned up formatting
      Moved camera offsets to new ReferenceCameraConfigurationWizard and updated existing wizards to use it instead of abstract. Also took the opportunity to refactor the two remaining wizards that were not using the abstract model.
      Reworks Zippy vision stuff a bit to not interfere with base OpenPnP vision. This can be refactored further to remove duplicate code, but it gets the job done for both systems now.
      Refactored JobProcessor so that it can be loaded from the config instead of hard coded. Created a new JobProcessor interface and moved the old code to ReferenceJobProcessor. Made ReferenceJobProcessor implement JobProcessor. Added config requirements for JobProcessor. Updated default config for JobProcessor.
      Removed temporary and extraneous files.
      Initial checkin of the CONTRIBUTING doc.
      essentially working, needs a couple tweeks
      nozzletip calibration working
      nozzletip changing working
      ...
    
    Conflicts:
            gui/src/main/java/org/openpnp/gui/JobPanel.java

commit 935cb2ceee4e7accfa61ea108d81b6b7de7d1445
Merge: aa2b682ce3 78662e4344
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat Jun 1 12:40:59 2013 -0700

    Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/firepick1/openpnp into firepick1-develop
    
    # By Karl Lew (3) and firepick1 (1)
    # Via Karl Lew (1) and firepick1 (1)
    * 'develop' of https://github.com/firepick1/openpnp:
      Update Main.java
      Logging for Reference... objects Added comments to log4j.properties
      Reconfigured IntelliJ IDEA auto-formatting to match openpnp coding standards. Specifically, use tabs.
      1) Renamed log4j.properties as log4j.properties.template so that openpnp will properly use log4j.properties in user.home folder even if openpnp-gui.jar is used by other artifacts. Without this change, the log4j.properties used for defaulting is in the classpath, with disables the user.home initialization. 2) Changed Main so that the slf4j intialization via LoggerFactory in Main happens AFTER log4j.properties has been properly defaulted on startup.
    
    Jason's modifications:
    Removed logging from simple properties.

commit a9d428399b1d8146ddbfb85d25ad8aeb2568a466
Author: Karl Lew <karl@firepick.org>
Date:   Mon May 27 18:36:31 2013 -0700

    1) Renamed log4j.properties as log4j.properties.template so that openpnp
    will properly use log4j.properties in user.home folder even if
    openpnp-gui.jar is used by other artifacts. Without this change, the
    log4j.properties used for defaulting is in the classpath, with disables
    the user.home initialization.
    2) Changed Main so that the slf4j intialization via LoggerFactory in Main
    happens AFTER log4j.properties has been properly defaulted on startup.

67	63	gui/src/main/java/org/openpnp/Main.java
0	0	gui/src/main/resources/{log4j.properties => log4j.properties.template}

    Updates the default units per pixel values for the TableScannerCamera in the sample config. These are the true values from the camera.

commit ffaa2dc2310100c948eb883762ce7ca00af05832
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Jan 27 22:35:23 2013 -0800

    BREAKING CHANGE: See notes below.
    Reworks reticles and outlines to use Java2D stuff.
    FiducialReticle and RulerReticle now respect rotation and show "north" like CrosshairReticle.
    Outline is now a simple interfac that returns units and a Shape for rendering. This will eventually allow more complex outlines to be used.
    With the Outline change, XML is now broken in packages.xml and boards.xml. Need to come up with a migration path for this, and in general.

commit 4d2b4ec2e2cfb691c7d80b8618cb2d938a9885cd
Author: Ami Sukarsa <sukarsa.ami@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 3 12:09:39 2012 +0200

    Small features and modifications:
    
    1. Import eagle parts: Create new parts and packages if it doesn't exist.
    All you need to do is to (later) fill in the informations (height of
    parts, feeder location,..)
    
    2. Bestfit board location.
    Use four points on the board, it tries to find the best rotation angle and
    offset to get the lowest total error.
    
    3. Sorting pick order.
    Sort the pick order according to the jobboard table. I also added "feeder"
    column and "progress" column. Sorting based on feeder is useful so you can
    "take-care" of cut-tapes one at a time. Todo (later): stop and ask before
    continuing with new feeder.
    
    4. Some small buttons:
    - Position camera/tool to the selected part in job-panel. This is useful
      for bestfit board-positionning. Just select the part, click to go there,
      adjust the position, and click next.
      - Feed, pick and place buttons.
    
    5. Driver for linux-cnc.
      Setup ip address/port in machine.xml

commit 26cc9dac1222e94691550a8ede64de37216becf1
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Jul 29 22:17:32 2012 -0700

    Lots and lots of little usability tweaks.
    List below is a list of notes I took while doing a short usabiliy study. So, these are not fixes but the bugs I saw which I then fixed.
    
    No part selected when creating a new placement, which will cause the save to fail. Probably should prompt for one during create.
    You don't really know what the tables are for. They probably need a title.
    Select row in boards panel.
    Units not set on new part height. Just default it.
    Package not set on new part. Prompt for it?
    Select new part.
    Need double click to select in class selection dialog.
    Create a default name for new feeders.
    Add not implemented error to feeder delete.
    Select new feeder.
    Get rid of / hide table scanner button.
    Set default feed rate when creating referencetapefeeder.
    Set default actuator.

commit e264159f01d78cb43c7e348fec5a27c1ff645bde
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Jul 29 17:27:42 2012 -0700

    A lot of general code cleanup and refactoring.
    Made Part properties in tables dropdowns.
    Made Package properties in tables dropdowns.
    Added a new Identifiable interface which most model items will eventually implement. This makes it easier to use them in lists.
    Changed upload-snapshot to check for unlicensed files before upload.
    Part now throws a RuntimeException if you try to set it's ID to null. I think setting is going to go away completely after a GUI review.
    Added the basic framework for adding new packages. This is somewhat dependant on the above ID decision and is not yet complete.
    Now that I think of it… I am probably getting closer to a database / primary key idea here.
    Got rid of the auto complete dropdowns for now. They look like hell and barely work.
    Added concrete list models for a few of the config lists.
    Upgraded to swingx 6.1.4.
    mvn eclipse:eclipse will now download and install javadocs and sources for dependencies.
    Changed build number to 5 characters only.

commit a080e20e7597f4930a01372c334ece8b3721b8ed
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sat Jul 21 12:18:42 2012 -0700

    Added the dock option to the Mac openpnp.sh startup script so it puts the right title in the menu bar.
    Temporarily changed the Show Part button in FeedersPanel (which is temporary itself) to be toggleable.
    Changed JobPanel Move To Board Location to move camera, not tool.
    Rebuilt the Reticle system to allow multiple Reticles on one CameraView. The Reticles are keyed so that different parts of the app can add and remove them as needed. There is also a default reticle which operates the way the old one did.
    Added a new OutlineReticle which replaces the outline on CameraView.
    Updates Reticles to allow for rotation based on the tool's rotation.
    Refactored NullDriver to include C and Z in movement updates.
    Changed Location add and subtract to leave rotation alone.
    Added the HslColor class, used for getting complementary colors.

Date:   Sun Jul 15 22:28:14 2012 -0700

    Finished the great unit conversion. All length values aside from previously mentioned exceptions are now shown in system units and when entering values, if a value is entered with no units it is converted on the fly to system units.
    Finally gave in and made Configuration a singleton. Didn't bother to go back and change all the places that were already passing it around.
    Moved all wizards into their own package.
    Added a decorator class for decorating JTextFields with auto select and length conversion properties.
    Updated all the wizards using JTextFields with the decorators.
    Consolidated the binding listener in all the wizards into a class and changed that class to disable the Apply button when a field is in error.
    Updated JBindings helpers to take multiple listeners.
    Probably a lot more… but that's what I remember.

commit afd57ecc942a6e82b7e619e6f3eb48f10ead264d
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Jul 15 11:55:11 2012 -0700

    All panels now store the divider location in preferences.
    Added SelectAllTable which causes text based cell fields to select all upon edit.
    Major refactoring of how length fields work in tables. Units are no longer required and if not specified then the system units will be used and the location converted. Placements and Parts show their native units while all other locations show system units.
    Added a preference for the display format used for length fields. Not currently user settable.

commit fa108dd25010a75917c1acf620c4e92ad228853d
Author: Jason von Nieda <jason@vonnieda.org>
Date:   Sun Jul 8 19:25:53 2012 -0700

    Moved Main into the main package and got rid of the app package.
    Added some icons and a README.txt. The README.txt contains decriptions of the icons so we can get a set made in the future.
    Removed the entire coordinate system system. Tool or absolute coordinates are always shown.
    Added a checkbox menu item under View for showing absolute coordinates.
    Consolidated the executors used to execute machine commands.
    Remove MCP.getDisplayedLocation and replaced with getToolLocation() and getCameraLocation().
    Added two new buttons to MCP that either add or subtract the camera coordinates. This allows the user to quickly move either the tool or the camera over a location.
    Fixed a sync bug in TableScannerCamera.
    Added an assert type thing in Configuration to restrict the program from being used with > 1 Heads. For now.
    Changed anything that grabbed the coordinates for config purposes to use getCameraLocation.
    Changed CameraPanel to only show the Show All option if there is more than one Camera.
    Changed CameraPanel to show, by default, the first Camera.

commit 5ecae7bfa4f6a9c72fc5e4cdd0353a48980ff29a
Author: jason@vonnieda.org <jason@vonnieda.org@6e4e58e8-af2a-93b2-b12c-a0314ddc677a>
Date:   Sat Nov 5 09:13:50 2011 +0000

    Moved the reticles into their own package.
    Added a nice overlay to the calibration mode of CameraView and made a nice generic method for doing clean text overlays in general.
    Reworked GrblDriver quite a bit to retain more state and do a better job of connection startup management. Now checks for proper version, turns off steppers and resets Grbl's offsets.

commit 8dc0eb24c5537e59cba133e67b29b5b6db92cdd1
Author: jason@vonnieda.org <jason@vonnieda.org@6e4e58e8-af2a-93b2-b12c-a0314ddc677a>
Date:   Sat Nov 5 09:11:27 2011 +0000

    Added support for G92 which sets the offsets in Grbl to the specified values. In reality, this just sets Grbl's current position to the specified values, but it accomplishes the same thing.
    Fixed a memcpy bug that didn't really seem to cause any problems anyway.
    Added some more docs to config.h.
    Changed startup process to emit "ok" at the end. Now the entire protocol is uniform.

    Renamed UnitTickReticle to RulerReticle.
    Added a popup menu to CameraView that allows selection of a reticle and turning on calibration mode.
    Added calibration mode to CameraView that lets you line up two crosshairs to determine physical size.

    Changed the bottom= attributes on Placement and BoardLocation to side=Top|Bottom.

commit dd784e1ec93160653b7cb858094e542bec286e40
Author: jason@vonnieda.org <jason@vonnieda.org@6e4e58e8-af2a-93b2-b12c-a0314ddc677a>
Date:   Wed Nov 2 06:04:19 2011 +0000

    Removed the forced dwell that I had previously added to synchronize commands. Hadn't noticed that there was a dwell command built in. GrblDriver now calls the dwell command (G4 P0) after each command to synchronize, leaving the firmware with the ability to queue commands if we decide we want that.
    Added the ability to enable and disable the stepper drivers with a $1000=0|1 command. Value is reflected in dumped settings but not stored in EEPROM.
    Added a read only $VERSION setting to make it easier to identify the version of software by client programs.
    Program now dumps settings on startup.
    Changed Grbl welcome string to OpenPnP/Grbl out of vanity.
    Implemented STEPPERS_ENABLE_INVERT.
    Changed version number from 0.6b to 0.7.
    
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://openpnp.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@63 6e4e58e8-af2a-93b2-b12c-a0314ddc677a

1	1	firmware/grbl/config.h
0	4	firmware/grbl/gcode.c
1	0	firmware/grbl/main.c
1	1	firmware/grbl/planner.h
1	1	firmware/grbl/serial_protocol.c
15	1	firmware/grbl/settings.c
1	1	firmware/grbl/settings.h

6	0	firmware/grbl/stepper.h

commit 7ea668dcf3b5469e650c33e45ec7781657b117d8
Author: jason@vonnieda.org <jason@vonnieda.org@6e4e58e8-af2a-93b2-b12c-a0314ddc677a>
Date:   Thu Oct 27 07:01:26 2011 +0000

    Broke out ports and pins so that certain functions can span multiple ports. This is needed to support 4 axes.
    Started working on moving everything from config.h into the EEPROM settings. This will make it so that end users don't have to compile and burn firmware. So far all settings are stored and read, but are not actually used in the code.
